translated: “Preceptor, it’s just like that. The tree in the park is completely gone.”

original: de nas thams cad 'dus te dong ba dang / de dag gis de kho na bzhin du ma mthong nas /
analyzed: de nas thams cad 'dus te dong ba dang / de dag gis de kho na bzhin du ma mthong nas /

original: bram ze'i khye'u dran pa dang ldan pa zhig yod pa de na re /
analyzed: bram ze'i khye'u dran pa dang ldan pa zhig yod pa de na re /
translated: A certain young brahmin who was mindful said,

original: phyogs 'di na ni mkhan po gsang tshig 'don par mdzad mdzad do //
analyzed: phyogs 'di na ni mkhan po gsang tshig 'don par mdzad mdzad do //
translated: “In this direction, the preceptor was reciting secret words.

original: phyogs 'di na ni bdag spyod spyod na de ci nongs /
analyzed: phyogs 'di na ni bdag spyod spyod na de ci nongs /
translated: In this direction, I was practicing. What is the problem?”

original: ji ltar gyur pa ma 'tshal to zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ji ltar gyur pa ma 'tshal to zhes zer ro //
translated: “I don’t know what happened.”

original: de dag de ltar sems khong du chud cing 'dug pa na /
analyzed: de dag de ltar sems khong du chud cing 'dug pa na /
translated: While they were sitting there, brooding,

original: mi zhig 'ongs nas des smras pa /
analyzed: mi zhig 'ongs nas des smras pa /
translated: a man came and said,

original: bram ze ci'i phyir 'khor dang bcas pa de ltar sems khong du chud cing 'khod /
analyzed: bram ze ci'i phyir 'khor dang bcas pa de ltar sems khong du chud cing 'khod /
translated: “Brahmin, why are you and your retinue sitting here brooding?”

original: kye dang po phyogs 'di na gnas kyi shing ljon pa zhig 'dug par gyur pa de mtshan mo gzhan gyis gar song ma shes so //
analyzed: kye dang po phyogs 'di na gnas kyi shing ljon pa zhig 'dug par gyur pa de mtshan mo gzhan gyis gar song ma shes so //
translated: “Hey, at first there was a tree here. I don’t know where it went last night.”

original: bam ze kho bos mdang sum mig la ma chad pa na /🔽phyogs 'di na drug sde dag mi @351a *//
analyzed: bam ze kho bos mdang sum mig la ma chad pa na / phyogs 'di na drug sde dag mi @351a *//
translated: “Brahmin, last night, when I was awake,🔽I saw the group of six🔽sitting here with axes, hatchets, and knives in their hands. Did they cut it down?”

original: sta re dang gzhor dang gle ba dag gis lag brel ba dang lhan cig 'dug pa mthong na de dag gis bcad par ma gyur tam /
analyzed: sta re dang gzhor dang gle ba dag gis lag brel ba dang lhan cig 'dug pa mthong na de dag gis bcad par ma gyur tam /
translated: If you see them sitting together with their hands busy with axes, hatchets, and knives, you should ask, “Have you not been cutting?”🔽

original: bram zes smras pa /
analyzed: bram zes smras pa /
translated: The brahmin said,

original: kye nang po 'on tang de lags so //
analyzed: kye nang po 'on tang de lags so //
translated: “Oh, that is so!”

original: zhes de dag de bzhin du sems khong du chud cing 'khod pa na /
analyzed: zhes de dag de bzhin du sems khong du chud cing 'khod pa na /
translated: While they were sitting there with their minds troubled,

original: drug sde dag lhags nas de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: drug sde dag lhags nas de dag gis smras pa /
translated: the group-of-six arrived. They said,

original: bram ze dag ci'i phyir sems khong du chud cing 'khod /
analyzed: bram ze dag ci'i phyir sems khong du chud cing 'khod /
translated: “Brahmins, why are you sitting here with your minds troubled?”

original: 'phags pa dag phyogs 'di na gnas kyi shing ljon pa zhig mchis par gyur pa de mtshan mo gzhan gyis gar mchis ma 'tshal to //
analyzed: 'phags pa dag phyogs 'di na gnas kyi shing ljon pa zhig mchis par gyur pa de mtshan mo gzhan gyis gar mchis ma 'tshal to //
translated: “Noble ones, a tree that was here in this place has disappeared. We don’t know where it went.”

original: drug sde dag gis bgad par brtsams pa dang / bram zes smras pa /
analyzed: drug sde dag gis bgad par brtsams pa dang / bram zes smras pa /

original: 'phags pa dag khyed cag gis ma bkum mam /
analyzed: 'phags pa dag khyed cag gis ma bkum mam /
translated: “Noble ones, did you not kill it?”

original: bkren pa dag khyed cag rtag tu de'i drung na 'khod cing kho bo cag la kye drug sde dag ci bsod snyoms mchog dang / bsod snyoms dang po thob bam /
analyzed: bkren pa dag khyed cag rtag tu de'i drung na 'khod cing kho bo cag la kye drug sde dag ci bsod snyoms mchog dang / bsod snyoms dang po thob bam /
translated: “You poor things, you always sit around it. We say to you, ‘Oh, group-of-six, did you get the best alms? Did you get the first alms?

analyzed: snod khengs sam zhes co 'dri bar byed pas de'i phyir khyed cag mi dga' bar bya'o //
translated: Did you get a full begging bowl?’ Because of that, you are unhappy.”

original: de dag sh'akya'i bu'i dge slong rnams kyi dge sbyong gi tshul ni tshig go /
analyzed: de dag sh'akya'i bu'i dge slong rnams kyi dge sbyong gi tshul ni tshig go /
translated: “The religious conduct of the Śākya son’s monks is finished.

original: bram ze'i tshul ni tshig ste /
analyzed: bram ze'i tshul ni tshig ste /
translated: Their brahmin conduct is finished.

original: 'di ltar gnas kyi shing ljon pa yang bcad par gyur to zhes smod par byed /🔽phyar ka gtong bar byed /
analyzed: 'di ltar gnas kyi shing ljon pa yang bcad par gyur to zhes smod par byed / phyar ka gtong bar byed /
translated: In this way, the trees in the monastery have been cut down.”🔽They criticized,

original: kha zer bar byed do //
analyzed: kha zer bar byed do //
translated: slandered, and disparaged them.

original: thos pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pas /
analyzed: thos pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pas /
translated: The news spread from one ear to another

original: ko'u shambhi na gnas pa'i skye bo'i tshogs dang / yul tha dad pa na gnas pa der lhags pa dag gis kyang thos nas /🔽de dag kyang lam po che dang srang dang bzhi mdo dang sum mdo dag na smod par byed /
analyzed: ko'u shambhi na gnas pa'i skye bo'i tshogs dang / yul tha dad pa na gnas pa der lhags pa dag gis kyang thos nas / de dag kyang lam po che dang srang dang bzhi mdo dang sum mdo dag na smod par byed /
translated: until it was heard by the people living in Kauśāmbī and by those living in other countries who had come there.🔽They too criticized,

original: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
translated: slandered, and disparaged them in the streets, in the squares, at the forking of three roads, and at the forking of four roads.🔽Those who had no faith did not give alms to those who were begging for alms.

original: kha zer bar byed cing @351b gang dag ma dad pa de dag gis ni bsod snyoms la zhugs pa dag la yang bsod snyoms sbyin par mi byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: kha zer bar byed cing @351b gang dag ma dad pa de dag gis ni bsod snyoms la zhugs pa dag la yang bsod snyoms sbyin par mi byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang gleng gzhi 'di dang skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //🔽nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang gleng gzhi 'di dang skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no // nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: Then the Blessed One, on this occasion, with regard to this situation, convened a gathering of the community of monks, saying, “Monks, a basis of training should be recited like this:

original: dge slong gis bdag po yod pa dge 'dun gyi phyir gtsug lag khang chen po brtsig tu 'jud na gzhi blta ba'i phyir dge slong des dge slong dag bkri bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong gis bdag po yod pa dge 'dun gyi phyir gtsug lag khang chen po brtsig tu 'jud na gzhi blta ba'i phyir dge slong des dge slong dag bkri bar bya'o //
translated: ‘If a monk, for the sake of the community, has a large dwelling built that has owners, that monk should be accompanied by monks when he inspects the site.

original: khrid pa'i dge slong dag gis kyang gzhi rung ba dang / rtsod pa med pa dang / brtsam du rung bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: khrid pa'i dge slong dag gis kyang gzhi rung ba dang / rtsod pa med pa dang / brtsam du rung bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: The monks who accompany him should look at the site to see if it is suitable, if it is free of disputes, and if it is suitable for building.🔽If a monk, for the sake of the community, has a large dwelling built that has owners, and he does not have monks accompany him when he inspects the site,

original: gal te dge slong gis gzhi mi rung ba'am /
analyzed: gal te dge slong gis gzhi mi rung ba'am /
translated: or if the site is not suitable,

original: rtsod pa dang bcas pa'am /🔽brtsam du mi rung bar bdag po yod pa dge 'dun gyi phyir gtsug lag khang chen po brtsig tu 'jud dam /
analyzed: rtsod pa dang bcas pa'am /🔽brtsam du mi rung bar bdag po yod pa dge 'dun gyi phyir gtsug lag khang chen po brtsig tu 'jud dam /
translated: or if it is disputed,🔽or if it is not suitable for building,

original: gzhi blta ba'i phyir dge slong dag kyang mi khrid dam /
analyzed: gzhi blta ba'i phyir dge slong dag kyang mi khrid dam /
translated: “Monks” means those who are bhikṣus.

original: dge slong khrid pa dag la gzhi mi ston na dge 'dun lhag ma'o //
analyzed: dge slong khrid pa dag la gzhi mi ston na dge 'dun lhag ma'o //
translated: “If he does not show the site to the monks who are leading, then it is a sthūlātyaya offense for the saṅgha.”

original: dge slong gis zhes bya ba ni drug sde'am gzhan yang chos 'dis pas so //
analyzed: dge slong gis zhes bya ba ni drug sde'am gzhan yang chos 'dis pas so //
translated: “Bhikṣu” means one of the group of six or another who is a follower of the Dharma.

original: bdag po yod pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bdag po yod pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “With an owner” means

original: gang la bdag po skyes pa'am bud med dam ma ning yod pa'o //
analyzed: gang la bdag po skyes pa'am bud med dam ma ning yod pa'o //
translated: that there is a male or female owner or a neuter owner.

original: dge 'dun gyi phyir zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gyi phyir ro //🔽gtsug lag khang zhes bya ba ni gang du spyod lam bzhi po 'chag pa dang / 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / @352a *//
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi phyir zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gyi phyir ro // gtsug lag khang zhes bya ba ni gang du spyod lam bzhi po 'chag pa dang / 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / @352a *//
translated: “For the saṅgha” means for the saṅgha of the Tathāgata’s śrāvakas.

original: nyal ba dag shong pa'o //
analyzed: nyal ba dag shong pa'o //
translated: “Monastery” means a place where the four activities of walking, standing, sitting, and lying down are possible.

original: chen po zhes bya ba ni chen po gnyis po sbyin par bya ba dang tshad kyis te /
analyzed: chen po zhes bya ba ni chen po gnyis po sbyin par bya ba dang tshad kyis te /
translated: “Large” means large in terms of the two things that are given and the size.

original: de las 'dir ni sbyin par bya bas chen por dgongs pa yin gyi tshad kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de las 'dir ni sbyin par bya bas chen por dgongs pa yin gyi tshad kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, it is intended that it is large in terms of what is given, not in terms of size.

original: brtsig tu 'jud na zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis sam gzhan gyis so //
analyzed: brtsig tu 'jud na zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis sam gzhan gyis so //
translated: “If he is having it built” means if he is having it built by himself or by others.

original: gzhi blta ba'i phyir dge slong des dge slong dag bkri bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhi blta ba'i phyir dge slong des dge slong dag bkri bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: “That monk should take along other monks in order to examine the site” means

analyzed: gzhi blta ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sa gzhi rung ba dang / rtsod pa med pa dang / brtsam du rung ba nyid blta ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “in order to examine the site” means in order to examine whether the site is suitable, free of conflict, and suitable for building.

original: dge slong des zhes bya ba ni dge slong gang yin pa des so //
analyzed: dge slong des zhes bya ba ni dge slong gang yin pa des so //
translated: “That monk” means the monk who is having the hut built.

analyzed: dge slong dag bkri bar bya zhes bya ba ni de na dge slong gang dag yod pa dag yin gyi /
translated: “Should take along other monks” means the monks who are there.

analyzed: ji tsam gyis gzhi de mig gis bltas par 'gyur pa'i dge slong de tsam bkri bar bya ba ni ma yin no //

analyzed: gal te de na sbrul gyi gnas sam / sdig pa'i gnas sam /
translated: If there is a snake’s nest,🔽a nest of scorpions,

analyzed: gal te gzhi de rung ba dang rnam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa yin na; dge slong des gtsug lag khang du song ste /
translated: If the site is suitable and complete in every respect, then the monk should go to the monastery and

analyzed: thugs brtse ba can dge 'dun btsun pa rnams kyis thugs brtse ba'i slad du /

analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi gzhi rung ba rtsod pa ma mchis pa brtsam du rung ba bstan pa stsal du gsol /

translated: Since he had no son and desired a son, he prayed to Śiva, Varuṇa, Kubera, Śakra, Brahmā, and other specific gods, saying,

original: kun dga' ra ba'i lha dag dang tshal gyi lha dag dang / bzhi mdo'i lha dag dang / sum mdo'i lha dag dang gtor ma len pa'i lha dag dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i lha dag dang / chos mthun pa dag dang rjes su 'brang ba'i lha dag la yang gsol ba 'debs so //
analyzed: kun dga' ra ba'i lha dag dang tshal gyi lha dag dang / bzhi mdo'i lha dag dang / sum mdo'i lha dag dang gtor ma len pa'i lha dag dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i lha dag dang / chos mthun pa dag dang rjes su 'brang ba'i lha dag la yang gsol ba 'debs so //
translated: He prays to the gods of the pleasure groves, the gods of the crossroads, the gods of the triple crossroads, the gods who receive offerings, the gods who are born together, the gods who are in harmony, and the gods who follow.

original: 'jig rten na gang gsol ba 'debs pa'i rgyu las bu dang bu mo dag skye'o zhes bya ba'i gtam de lta bu yod de /
analyzed: 'jig rten na gang gsol ba 'debs pa'i rgyu las bu dang bu mo dag skye'o zhes bya ba'i gtam de lta bu yod de /
translated: “In the world, there is a saying that sons and daughters are born from the union of parents and the prayer of the gods.

original: de ni de lta bu ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de lta bu ma yin te /
translated: But that is not the case.

original: gal te de ltar gyur du zin na re re la yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gal te de ltar gyur du zin na re re la yang 'di lta ste /
translated: If that were the case, then each person would have a thousand sons,

original: dper na 'khor @356a *//🔽los sgyur ba'i rgyal po bzhin du bu stong yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na 'khor @356a *// los sgyur ba'i rgyal po bzhin du bu stong yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: like the universal monarch.

original: 'di ltar gnas gsum po dag mngon du gyur pa las bu dang bu mo dag skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gnas gsum po dag mngon du gyur pa las bu dang bu mo dag skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Sons and daughters are born when three conditions are present:

original: gsum po de dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum po de dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: pha dang ma gnyis chags par gyur cing 'dus pa dang / ma dus la bab cing zla mtshan dang ldan pa dang / dri za nye bar gnas shing 'jug 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: pha dang ma gnyis chags par gyur cing 'dus pa dang / ma dus la bab cing zla mtshan dang ldan pa dang / dri za nye bar gnas shing 'jug 'dod pa ste /
translated: When the father and mother are attracted to each other and unite, when the mother is in season and fertile, and when the gandharva is present and wishes to enter,

analyzed: gnas gsum pa de dag mngon du gyur pa las bu dang bu mo dag skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the child is conceived from the union of the parents’ reproductive substances and the gandharva.

analyzed: de de ltar gsol ba 'debs pa lhur len cing 'dug pa na /
translated: While the Bodhisattva was still in his mother’s womb, he was radiant,🔽and he was not sullied by any impurities such as blood or mucus.🔽He was sitting cross-legged,🔽and he was teaching the Dharma to gods and bodhisattvas.🔽The Bodhisattva’s mother was happy and comfortable,🔽and she was not afflicted by the usual discomforts of pregnancy.🔽She was not touched by any afflictions,🔽and she was not overcome by sexual desire.🔽She was not attached to sensual pleasures,🔽and she was not attached to food and drink.

original: sems can srid pa tha ma pa spyod pa tshol ba thar pa'i snying po bzung ba mya ngan las 'das pa la phyogs pa 'khor ba las phyir phyogs pa srid pa'i 'gro ba thams cad du 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba don du mi gnyer ba lus tha ma 'dzin pa zhig kyang lha'i rigs bzang po zhig nas shi 'phos te /

original: 'di lta ste mngal na gnas pa yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir steng gi khang bzang gi gzhir grang ba na grang ba'i yo byad dag dang / dro ba na dro ba'i yo byad dag dang / sman pas bcas pa'i zas ha cang mi kha ba dang /

translated: In order to fully ripen the being in the womb, the mother should live in the upper part of the house, where it is cool in the hot season, warm in the cold season, and where she is given cool and warm things to use.

original: ha cang mi skyur ba dang / ha cang lan tshva mi che ba dang / ha cang mi mngar ba dang / ha cang mi tsha ba dang / ha cang mi bska ba dang / kha ba dang skyur ba dang / lan tshva che ba dang mngar ba dang tsha ba dang /

translated: She should eat food that is not too sour, not too salty, not too pungent, not too sweet, not too bitter, not too astringent, and she should avoid food that is sour, salty, pungent, sweet, bitter, or astringent.

original: bska ba rnam par spangs pa'i zas dag dang / do shal dang se mo do dang / rgyan gyis klubs pa'i lus la lha'i bu mo dga' ba'i @357a *//

translated: He is not placed on the ground, but on a bed or a bench, and he is carried from bed to bed, from bench to bench. He does not hear any unpleasant sounds. He is served without any harm being done to him.

original: mdzes pa gsal ba gser gyi mdog 'dra ba /
analyzed: mdzes pa gsal ba gser gyi mdog 'dra ba /
translated: After eight or nine months, he is born. He is a boy, well-proportioned, pleasing to the eye, handsome, radiant, with the skin the color of gold,

original: mgo bo gdugs lta bu dang ldan pa /
analyzed: mgo bo gdugs lta bu dang ldan pa /
translated: with a well-proportioned head,

original: lag pa ring ba dpral ba'i dbyes che ba /
analyzed: lag pa ring ba dpral ba'i dbyes che ba /

original: smin ma 'dzar ba /
analyzed: smin ma 'dzar ba /
translated: eyebrows that meet,

original: sna'i gzengs mtho ba zhig byung ngo //
analyzed: sna'i gzengs mtho ba zhig byung ngo //

analyzed: khye'u de'i kun tu spyod pa ni ji srid du mal chen po nas ma phab pa de srid du bshang ba dang gci ba mi byed pa yin la /

analyzed: yul dbus na kun tu spyod pa ni gang mkhas pa spyod pa gsal ba de la nor lta bu zhes zer bas /
translated: The behavior in the central country is that what is called “like wealth” is the clear conduct of the wise.

original: nye du de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: nye du de dag gis smras pa /

analyzed: shes ldan dag khye'u 'di gyad kyi sna chen po la gtogs pa rgyal sde'i bu yang yin la /

original: ji srid du mal chen po nas ma phab pa de srid du bshang ba dang gci ba mi byed de /
analyzed: ji srid du mal chen po nas ma phab pa de srid du bshang ba dang gci ba mi byed de /
translated: and as long as he is not taken down from his great bed, he does not defecate or urinate.

original: mkhas pa spyod pa gsal bas nor lta bu yang yin pa'i phyir khye'u 'di'i ming gyad bu nor zhes bya'o zhes de'i ming gyad bu nor zhes bya bar btags so //

translated: Because he is also like wealth, the clear conduct of the wise, the child’s name will be Gyadubunor, Wealth of the Son of a Wrestler.” Thus, his name was given as Gyadubunor.

original: nyi ma gang la gyad bu nor btsas pa'i nyi ma de nyid la blon po lnga brgya dag la yang bu dag btsas te /
analyzed: nyi ma gang la gyad bu nor btsas pa'i nyi ma de nyid la blon po lnga brgya dag la yang bu dag btsas te /
translated: On the very day Gyadubunor was born, five hundred ministers also had sons born to them.

analyzed: de dag gi ming yang khyim dang @357b mthun pa dag tu btags shing /

analyzed: de dag kyang gyad bu nor gyis ne'u ldangs su byas so //
translated: They were all raised by the young man Jyotiṣka.

analyzed: gang dag 'di la mchod pa dag byed pa de dag gi mchod pa byas pa de dag ni shin tu 'bras bu chen po dang phan yon chen po dang gsal ba chen po dang yangs pa chen por 'gyur bas de'i phyir 'di la mchod pa dag gyis shig

analyzed: de'i phyir bdag cag gis ci nas kyang dmag dpon la go bar bya ba'i thabs shig gis 'di yang ri dvags gshor du 'gro bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i thabs shig byas na des na 'di yang bdag cag dang lhan cig ri dvags gshor du 'gro bar 'gyur
translated: Therefore, we should devise a plan to make him go hunting so that he will go with us.”

analyzed: ro zhes de dag gis gros byas nas dmag dpon gyi gan du dong ste /

analyzed: rkang pa gnyis la phyag 'tshal nas smras pa /

analyzed: shes ldan dag gal te de ltar na gzhon nu gtang gis deng zhig /

You are the king’s general.

analyzed: des na khyod kyis ri dvags mchis so 'tshal khum par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: gzhon nus ri dvags de dag gnas skabs de ltar gyur pa thag ring po kho na nas mthong nas des bsams pa /

analyzed: snying rje med pa'i snying gis 'jig rten pha rol btang ste /
translated: “Who would be so cruel-hearted as to disregard the next world

analyzed: 'di dag la sems kyis rab tu sdang bar 'gyur ba yang su zhig yod na /

analyzed: mda' de dag kyang ri dvags de dag gi rva'i bar dag dang rkang lag gi bar dag tu btang nas de'i 'og tu des brtsal ba btang ste 'dug pa dang / ri dvags de dag kyang byer te dong ngo //
translated: He shot the arrows between the legs and arms of the deer, and then he stopped looking for them and sat down. The deer ran away.

original: blon po'i bu rnams kyis bsams pa /
analyzed: blon po'i bu rnams kyis bsams pa /
translated: The sons of the ministers thought,

original: gzhon nu ni gnas lnga dag la byang bar gyur pa yin pas /🔽des gdon mi za bar ri dvags mang po dag bsad par gyur gyis bdag cag myur du dong ngo snyam nas /
analyzed: gzhon nu ni gnas lnga dag la byang bar gyur pa yin pas / des gdon mi za bar ri dvags mang po dag bsad par gyur gyis bdag cag myur du dong ngo snyam nas /
translated: “The prince is skilled in the five fields of knowledge.🔽He will certainly have killed many deer. Let us go quickly.”

original: de dag myur du lhags pa dang ri dvags gcig kyang ma sod par mthong nas /
analyzed: de dag myur du lhags pa dang ri dvags gcig kyang ma sod par mthong nas /
translated: They went quickly and saw that he had not killed a single deer.

original: de dag @361a *//🔽'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de dag @361a *// 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: They think, We are the ones who should be given the best seats, the best dwellings, the best bedding, the best food, and the best medicine.

original: gzhon nus gdon mi za bar shing rta dag dang / rnga mo dag gis sngar bskyas par gyur pa lta snyam du rig nas smras pa /🔽gzhon nu ri dvags de dag gar mchis /
analyzed: gzhon nus gdon mi za bar shing rta dag dang / rnga mo dag gis sngar bskyas par gyur pa lta snyam du rig nas smras pa / gzhon nu ri dvags de dag gar mchis /
translated: They thought, The prince must have killed the deer with his chariot and camels.🔽 They said, Prince, where are the deer?

original: shes ldan dag ri dvags dag ga re /🔽ri dvags dag su'i yin /
analyzed: shes ldan dag ri dvags dag ga re / ri dvags dag su'i yin /
translated: They said, Sirs, where are the deer?🔽 They said, Whose deer are they?

original: de dag ni ri dvags nyid yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni ri dvags nyid yin te /
translated: They said, They are deer.

original: phyir bcos par mi nus so //
analyzed: phyir bcos par mi nus so //
translated: It is impossible to correct them.

original: de dag spyod pa de lta bu dang shugs de lta bus rgyug pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag spyod pa de lta bu dang shugs de lta bus rgyug pas de'i phyir /
translated: They said, Because of their behavior and speed,

original: de dag gis kho bo nyid kyang de'u bsad do //🔽mi des smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis kho bo nyid kyang de'u bsad do // mi des smras pa /
translated: we ourselves killed the deer.

original: shes ldan dag khyed kyis chos la dga' ba 'di 'phan khar bzhag pas ri dvags ga la sod /
analyzed: shes ldan dag khyed kyis chos la dga' ba 'di 'phan khar bzhag pas ri dvags ga la sod /
translated: The man said, Sirs, how could you kill the deer when you placed this man who loves the Dharma in the chariot?

original: gal te 'di mngon par 'dod par gyur na ri dvags gcig kyang bros par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'di mngon par 'dod par gyur na ri dvags gcig kyang bros par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If he had wanted to, not a single deer would have escaped.

original: de dag mi bzod pa skyes nas mtha' gcig tu dong ste smras pa /
analyzed: de dag mi bzod pa skyes nas mtha' gcig tu dong ste smras pa /
translated: They became angry and went to one side and said, Sirs, let us kill this man who loves the Dharma.

original: shes ldan dag bdag cag gi lus smas pa dang / rnam par smas pa dag gis ri dvags dag 'di ga la ba der btab ste /
analyzed: shes ldan dag bdag cag gi lus smas pa dang / rnam par smas pa dag gis ri dvags dag 'di ga la ba der btab ste /
translated: “Sirs, our bodies are wounded and bruised from striking the deer.🔽If we go back to where the deer is, he will kill it.

original: 'dis bsad grang snyam na 'dis yal bar bor gyis 'dong la 'di nyid gsad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis bsad grang snyam na 'dis yal bar bor gyis 'dong la 'di nyid gsad par bya'o //
translated: Let’s go and kill him.”

original: de dag gis yang bsams pa /
analyzed: de dag gis yang bsams pa /
translated: They thought,

original: gal te 'di bsad par gyur na thos pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pas dmag dpon gyis thos na bdag la gnod pa byed par 'gyur gyis /
analyzed: gal te 'di bsad par gyur na thos pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pas dmag dpon gyis thos na bdag la gnod pa byed par 'gyur gyis /
translated: “If we kill him, the news will spread from one to another until the general hears about it and harms us.

original: 'di bsad par mi bya bar 'di 'di ltar 'di nyid du bskyur te bor la bdag cag 'dong bar bya'o snyam nas /
analyzed: 'di bsad par mi bya bar 'di 'di ltar 'di nyid du bskyur te bor la bdag cag 'dong bar bya'o snyam nas /
translated: We will not kill him. We will leave him here and go.”

original: de dag gis de la ma bltas par dong ngo //
analyzed: de dag gis de la ma bltas par dong ngo //
translated: They left without looking back.

original: gzhon nus bsams pa /
analyzed: gzhon nus bsams pa /
translated: The prince thought,

original: de dag bdag gi ne'u @361b ldangs mnyam du skyes pa sa la lhan cig rtse rtse ba yin na /
analyzed: de dag bdag gi ne'u @361b ldangs mnyam du skyes pa sa la lhan cig rtse rtse ba yin na /
translated: “These are my friends from childhood, who played with me on the ground.

original: ri dvags tsam gyi phyir de dag gis bdag dgon par bskyur te bor nas dong ba las na /
analyzed: ri dvags tsam gyi phyir de dag gis bdag dgon par bskyur te bor nas dong ba las na /
translated: For the sake of a deer, they left me in the wilderness and went away.

original: gang gi tshe bdag gi pha 'das nas bdag dmag dpon du gyur pa de'i tshe na bdag gis gdon mi za bar sems can gyi gnas la nyes par spyod pa mang po bya dgos pas 'gyur ro snyam nas /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bdag gi pha 'das nas bdag dmag dpon du gyur pa de'i tshe na bdag gis gdon mi za bar sems can gyi gnas la nyes par spyod pa mang po bya dgos pas 'gyur ro snyam nas /
translated: When my father dies and I become the general, I will certainly have to commit many evil deeds against living beings.”

original: de snying stong zhing zug rngus zug pa bzhin du rtog pa na /
analyzed: de snying stong zhing zug rngus zug pa bzhin du rtog pa na /
translated: He thought like this, and his heart was filled with anguish, as if he were pierced by a thorn.

original: khyim du song ste lag pa la 'gram pa gtad nas sems khong du chud cing 'dug go /
analyzed: khyim du song ste lag pa la 'gram pa gtad nas sems khong du chud cing 'dug go /
translated: He went home and sat there, his cheek resting on his hand, his mind troubled.

original: de'i gan du chung ma'i 'khor dag 'ong ba de dag des mthong ba dang / dbang po dag phyir glon par byed do //
analyzed: de'i gan du chung ma'i 'khor dag 'ong ba de dag des mthong ba dang / dbang po dag phyir glon par byed do //
translated: His wives came to him, but he turned away from them.

original: de dag gis gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pas dmag dpon la gzhon nu te bor sems khong du chud de mchis brang gi 'khor la yang mi sems par dbang po dag slar glon zhing mchis so zhes go bar byas so //
analyzed: de dag gis gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pas dmag dpon la gzhon nu te bor sems khong du chud de mchis brang gi 'khor la yang mi sems par dbang po dag slar glon zhing mchis so zhes go bar byas so //
translated: They told the king, “The young general is sitting there, his mind troubled, not paying attention to his wives, turning away from them.”

original: dmag dpon gyis thos nas de yang yid mi bde bar gyur nas gzhon nu'i gan du song ste smras pa /
analyzed: dmag dpon gyis thos nas de yang yid mi bde bar gyur nas gzhon nu'i gan du song ste smras pa /
translated: The general heard this and became unhappy. He went to the prince and said,

original: bu gzhon nu khyod ci'i phyir lag pa la 'gram pa gtad de sems khong du chud cing 'dug /
analyzed: bu gzhon nu khyod ci'i phyir lag pa la 'gram pa gtad de sems khong du chud cing 'dug /
translated: “Son, prince, why do you sit with your cheek in your hand, your mind troubled?”

original: yab kyis bdag las mi 'dra bar bskos te /🔽gang gi tshe rngon pa drag shul can lag pa dmar ba bsnun pa dang rab tu bsnun pa la zhugs pa gzhan gyi srog 'phrog pa gzhan gyi srog gcod du 'jud pa /
analyzed: yab kyis bdag las mi 'dra bar bskos te / gang gi tshe rngon pa drag shul can lag pa dmar ba bsnun pa dang rab tu bsnun pa la zhugs pa gzhan gyi srog 'phrog pa gzhan gyi srog gcod du 'jud pa /
translated: “Father, you have appointed me to a different task.🔽When I am engaged in the violent, bloody work of hunting, in the pursuit of killing, in taking the lives of others, in causing others to kill,

original: gzhan gyi srog gcod pas 'tsho bar bgyid pa rnams kyi las de la nges par sbyar na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi srog gcod pas 'tsho bar bgyid pa rnams kyi las de la nges par sbyar na /
translated: in making a living by taking the lives of others,

original: bdag ji ltar sems khong du chud cing mi mchis su rung /
analyzed: bdag ji ltar sems khong du chud cing mi mchis su rung /
translated: how could I not be troubled?”

original: bu gzhon nu gal te khyod bde @362a *//
analyzed: bu gzhon nu gal te khyod bde @362a *//
translated: “Son, prince, if you are happy,

original: bar 'dug la bsam pa thong ste phyin chad ma 'gro zhig /
analyzed: bar 'dug la bsam pa thong ste phyin chad ma 'gro zhig /
translated: give up your thoughts and do not go out again.”

original: de nas gzhon nu de sems can la gnod pa las skyes pa'i yid mi bde ba las nges par byung ste mngon par dga' bar gyur nas /
analyzed: de nas gzhon nu de sems can la gnod pa las skyes pa'i yid mi bde ba las nges par byung ste mngon par dga' bar gyur nas /
translated: Then the young man, having emerged from the mental dissatisfaction that arises from harming sentient beings, became truly joyful.

original: dge ba gang yin zhes tshol bas nges par 'byung ba'i mngon par dga' ba btsal bar brtsams so //
analyzed: dge ba gang yin zhes tshol bas nges par 'byung ba'i mngon par dga' ba btsal bar brtsams so //
translated: Since he was searching for what is virtuous, he began to search for the joy of liberation.

original: de'i tshe na rdzogs byed la sogs pa ston pa drug po thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par thams cad mkhyen par mngon pa'i nga rgyal can dag sdig byung na nye bar rten cing gnas so //
analyzed: de'i tshe na rdzogs byed la sogs pa ston pa drug po thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par thams cad mkhyen par mngon pa'i nga rgyal can dag sdig byung na nye bar rten cing gnas so //
translated: At that time, the six teachers such as Pūraṇa Kāśyapa, who were not omniscient but had the pride of being so, were living in Pāpā.

original: de nas gzhon nu gyad bu nor gyis pha dang chung ma'i 'khor la ma bltas par 'od srung rdzogs byed ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
analyzed: de nas gzhon nu gyad bu nor gyis pha dang chung ma'i 'khor la ma bltas par 'od srung rdzogs byed ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
translated: Then the young Varuṇadeva, without looking at his father, wife, or retinue, went to where Pūraṇa Kāśyapa was.

original: 'od srung rdzogs byed la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: 'od srung rdzogs byed la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Having arrived, he said this to Pūraṇa Kāśyapa:

original: shes can khyod kyi chos kyi tshul ni gang yin /
analyzed: shes can khyod kyi chos kyi tshul ni gang yin /
translated: O wise one, what is your Dharma system?

original: slob ma la gdams pa ni gang yin /
analyzed: slob ma la gdams pa ni gang yin /
translated: What are your instructions to students?

original: tshangs par spyod pa'i 'bras bu ni gang yin /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa'i 'bras bu ni gang yin /
translated: What are the fruits of pure conduct?

original: phan yon ni gang yin /
analyzed: phan yon ni gang yin /
translated: What are the benefits?

original: rdzogs byed kyis smras pa /
analyzed: rdzogs byed kyis smras pa /
translated: Pūraṇa replied:

original: gzhon nu kho bo ni 'di ltar lta zhing 'di skad ces smra ste /
analyzed: gzhon nu kho bo ni 'di ltar lta zhing 'di skad ces smra ste /
translated: “Young man, I see and say this:

original: sbyin pa med do //🔽mchod sbyin med do //
analyzed: sbyin pa med do // mchod sbyin med do //
translated: There is no generosity.🔽There is no sacrifice.

original: sbyin sreg med do //
analyzed: sbyin sreg med do //
translated: There is no burnt offering.

original: legs par spyad pa med do //
analyzed: legs par spyad pa med do //
translated: There is no good conduct.

original: nyes par spyad pa med do //
analyzed: nyes par spyad pa med do //
translated: There is no bad conduct.

original: legs par spyad pa dang nyes par spyad pa'i las rnams kyi 'bras bu dang rnam par smin pa med do //
analyzed: legs par spyad pa dang nyes par spyad pa'i las rnams kyi 'bras bu dang rnam par smin pa med do //
translated: There are no actions and results of actions.

original: 'jig rten 'di ni med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di ni med do //
translated: There is no this world.

original: 'jig rten pha rol med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol med do //
translated: There is no next world.

original: ma med do //
analyzed: ma med do //
translated: There is no mother.

original: pha med do //
analyzed: pha med do //
translated: There is no father.

original: sems can rdzus te skyes pa med do //
analyzed: sems can rdzus te skyes pa med do //
translated: There are no beings born through miraculous birth.

original: 'jig rten na dgra bcom pa yang dag par rtogs pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten na dgra bcom pa yang dag par rtogs pa /
translated: In the world, there are no arhats who have realized

original: yang dag par sgrub pa gang dag tshe 'di @362b nyid la rang gi mngon par shes pas 'jig rten 'di dang 'jig rten pha rol mngon sum du byas nas bsgrubs te /🔽bdag cag ni skye ba zad do //
analyzed: yang dag par sgrub pa gang dag tshe 'di @362b nyid la rang gi mngon par shes pas 'jig rten 'di dang 'jig rten pha rol mngon sum du byas nas bsgrubs te / bdag cag ni skye ba zad do //
translated: and accomplished the truth, who have seen this world and the next world with their own supernormal knowledge, and who have attained liberation in this very life,🔽saying, ‘Our births have come to an end.

original: tshangs par spyad pa bsten to //
analyzed: tshangs par spyad pa bsten to //
translated: We have lived the spiritual life.

original: bya ba byas so //
analyzed: bya ba byas so //
translated: “The task is done.

original: srid pa 'di las gzhan mi shes so zhes go bar byed pa dag med do //
analyzed: srid pa 'di las gzhan mi shes so zhes go bar byed pa dag med do //
translated: There is no more beyond this existence.”

original: srog 'di nyid la 'tsho zhing de phyis 'chad par 'gyur /
analyzed: srog 'di nyid la 'tsho zhing de phyis 'chad par 'gyur /
translated: “This very life is lived; after that, there is no more.

original: zhig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhig par 'gyur te /
translated: It is cut off; it perishes.

original: shi ba'i 'og tu mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: shi ba'i 'og tu mi 'byung ngo //
translated: After death, there is no arising.

original: skyes bu'i lus ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi las gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: skyes bu'i lus ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi las gyur pa yin te /
translated: The body of a person is made from the four great elements.

original: de ni gang gi tshe dus byed pa na de'i sa'i lus ni sa'i bag la zha /
analyzed: de ni gang gi tshe dus byed pa na de'i sa'i lus ni sa'i bag la zha /
translated: When the time comes for it to die, the earth in the body returns to earth,

original: chu'i lus ni chu'i /🔽me'i lus ni me'i /
analyzed: chu'i lus ni chu'i / me'i lus ni me'i /
translated: the water in the body returns to water,🔽the fire in the body returns to fire,

original: rlung gi lus ni rlung gi bag la zha bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rlung gi lus ni rlung gi bag la zha bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and the air in the body returns to air.

original: dbang po rnams ni mkha'i rjes su 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po rnams ni mkha'i rjes su 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The faculties follow the sky.

original: skyes bu'i ro ni khri dang lnga'i mi dag gis khyer te /
analyzed: skyes bu'i ro ni khri dang lnga'i mi dag gis khyer te /
translated: Five or six people carry the corpse of a person🔽to the charnel ground.

original: dur khrod du 'gro zhing bsregs phan chad mi mngon par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dur khrod du 'gro zhing bsregs phan chad mi mngon par 'gyur ro //
translated: After it is burned, it is no more.

original: bsreg bya dag ni thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsreg bya dag ni thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The things that were burned become ash.

original: rus pa dag ni thi ba'i mdog 'dra bar gnas so //
analyzed: rus pa dag ni thi ba'i mdog 'dra bar gnas so //
translated: The bones turn the color of a dove.

original: 'di ltar rmongs pa nye bar bstan pa ni sbyin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar rmongs pa nye bar bstan pa ni sbyin la /
translated: The ignorant are taught to give,

original: mkhas pa nye bar bstan pa ni len te /
analyzed: mkhas pa nye bar bstan pa ni len te /
translated: while the wise are taught to receive.🔽All those who speak of existence are liars,

original: de la gang dag yod par smra ba de dag thams cad ni gsob gsog brdzun du smra ba dag yin no //
analyzed: de la gang dag yod par smra ba de dag thams cad ni gsob gsog brdzun du smra ba dag yin no //
translated: swindlers, and frauds.

original: 'di ltar byis pa dang mkhas pa de gnyis ni phyis 'chad par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar byis pa dang mkhas pa de gnyis ni phyis 'chad par 'gyur /
translated: The ignorant and the wise will be explained later.

original: zhig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhig par 'gyur te /
translated: They will be destroyed,

original: shi ba'i 'og tu mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: shi ba'i 'og tu mi 'byung ngo //
translated: and after death they will not arise.

original: de nas gyad bu nor 'di snyam du sems te; ston pa shes ldan 'di ni lam gol bar zhugs pa /
analyzed: de nas gyad bu nor 'di snyam du sems te; ston pa shes ldan 'di ni lam gol bar zhugs pa /
translated: Then Ghoṣila thought, “This teacher is on the wrong path.

original: lam ngan pa legs par sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: lam ngan pa legs par sgrub pa yin te /
translated: He is practicing a bad path.

original: lam 'jigs pa dang bcas pa ji lta ba bzhin du mkhas pa rnams kyis spang bar bya ba yin no snyam @363a *//
analyzed: lam 'jigs pa dang bcas pa ji lta ba bzhin du mkhas pa rnams kyis spang bar bya ba yin no snyam @363a *//
translated: The wise should abandon it just as they would a dangerous path.”

original: du rig nas tshigs su bcad pa smras pa /
analyzed: du rig nas tshigs su bcad pa smras pa /
translated: Understanding this, he spoke a verse:

original: blo ngan log par ston byed pa //
analyzed: blo ngan log par ston byed pa //
translated: “The one with bad ideas who teaches wrongly

original: dman pa ston par grags pa ste //🔽gang gi chos 'di de 'dra ba //
analyzed: dman pa ston par grags pa ste // gang gi chos 'di de 'dra ba //
translated: is known as a teacher of the inferior.🔽If his Dharma is like that,

original: de yi chos min ci zhig 'dra //
analyzed: de yi chos min ci zhig 'dra //
translated: what is his non-Dharma like?”

original: zhes smras nas snod stong pa bzhin du brdabs te song ngo //🔽de nas gyad bu nor gnag lhas kyi bu kun tu rgyu ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
analyzed: zhes smras nas snod stong pa bzhin du brdabs te song ngo // de nas gyad bu nor gnag lhas kyi bu kun tu rgyu ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
translated: Having said this, he left like an empty vessel.🔽Then, the young Licchavi Girika went to the wandering mendicant Pūraṇa Kāśyapa and said,

original: gnag lhas kyi bu kun tu rgyu la 'di skad ces smras so; ;shes ldan khyod kyi chos kyi tshul ni gang yin /
analyzed: gnag lhas kyi bu kun tu rgyu la 'di skad ces smras so; ;shes ldan khyod kyi chos kyi tshul ni gang yin /
translated: “Sir, what is your Dharma system?

original: slob ma la gdams pa ni gang yin /
analyzed: slob ma la gdams pa ni gang yin /
translated: What are your instructions to your disciples?

original: tshangs par spyod pa'i 'bras bu ni gang yin /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa'i 'bras bu ni gang yin /
translated: What are the fruits of pure conduct?

original: phan yon ni gang yin /🔽kun tu rgyus smras pa /
analyzed: phan yon ni gang yin / kun tu rgyus smras pa /
translated: What are the benefits?”🔽The wandering mendicant replied,

original: gzhon nu kho bo ni 'di ltar lta zhing 'di skad smra ste /🔽sems can rnams kun nas nyon mongs par gyur pa la rgyu med rkyen med do //🔽sems can rnams rgyu med rkyen med par kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhon nu kho bo ni 'di ltar lta zhing 'di skad smra ste / sems can rnams kun nas nyon mongs par gyur pa la rgyu med rkyen med do // sems can rnams rgyu med rkyen med par kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: “Young man, I see and say this:🔽Sentient beings become defiled without cause or condition.🔽Sentient beings become defiled without cause or condition.

original: sems can rnams rnam par dag par 'gyur ba la rgyu med rkyen med do //
analyzed: sems can rnams rnam par dag par 'gyur ba la rgyu med rkyen med do //
translated: Sentient beings become purified without cause or condition.

original: sems can rnams rgyu med rkyen med par rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //🔽sems can rnams shes pa med par 'gyur ba dang / mthong ba med par 'gyur ba la rgyu med rkyen med do //
analyzed: sems can rnams rgyu med rkyen med par rnam par dag par 'gyur ro // sems can rnams shes pa med par 'gyur ba dang / mthong ba med par 'gyur ba la rgyu med rkyen med do //
translated: Sentient beings become pure without cause or condition.🔽Sentient beings become without consciousness and without seeing without cause or condition.

original: sems can rnams rgyu med rkyen med par shes pa med pa dang mthong ba med par 'gyur ro //🔽sems can rnams shes par gyur pa dang mthong bar 'gyur ba la rgyu med rkyen med do //
analyzed: sems can rnams rgyu med rkyen med par shes pa med pa dang mthong ba med par 'gyur ro // sems can rnams shes par gyur pa dang mthong bar 'gyur ba la rgyu med rkyen med do //
translated: Sentient beings become without consciousness and without seeing without cause or condition.🔽Sentient beings become conscious and seeing without cause or condition.

original: sems can rnams rgyu med rkyen med par shes pa dang mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can rnams rgyu med rkyen med par shes pa dang mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Sentient beings become conscious and seeing without cause or condition.

original: stobs med do //
analyzed: stobs med do //
translated: There is no power.

original: brtson 'grus med do //
analyzed: brtson 'grus med do //
translated: There is no striving.

original: @363b stobs dang brtson 'grus med do //
analyzed: @363b stobs dang brtson 'grus med do //
translated: There is no power and no striving.

original: skyes bu'i rtsal med do //
analyzed: skyes bu'i rtsal med do //
translated: There is no human effort.

original: pha rol gnon pa med do //
analyzed: pha rol gnon pa med do //
translated: There is no mastery.

original: skyes bu'i rtsal dang pha rol gnon pa med do //
analyzed: skyes bu'i rtsal dang pha rol gnon pa med do //
translated: There is no human effort and no mastery.

original: bdag gi rtsal med do //
analyzed: bdag gi rtsal med do //
translated: There is no one’s own effort.

original: gzhan gyi rtsal med do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rtsal med do //
