original: gang gi tshe 'di ting nge 'dzin las langs par gyur pa de'i tshe de'i drung du 'gro bar bya'o snyam du rig nas mtha' gcig tu 'dug ste de ldang ba la sdod cing 'dug go /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di ting nge 'dzin las langs par gyur pa de'i tshe de'i drung du 'gro bar bya'o snyam du rig nas mtha' gcig tu 'dug ste de ldang ba la sdod cing 'dug go /
translated: Having understood this, he sat down in one place and waited for him to rise.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rta thul phye ma bred nang du yang dag 'jog las langs nas mtha' gcig tu 'dug go /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rta thul phye ma bred nang du yang dag 'jog las langs nas mtha' gcig tu 'dug go /
translated: Then the venerable Aśvajit rose from his meditative absorption and sat down in one place.

original: de nas gyad bu nor tshe dang ldan pa rta thul ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
analyzed: de nas gyad bu nor tshe dang ldan pa rta thul ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
translated: Then the venerable Aśvajit went to the venerable Aśvajit and

original: tshe dang ldan pa rta thul dang lhan cig mngon du yang dag par dga' bar 'gyur ba dang / yang dag par mgu bar 'gyur ba'i gtam sna tshogs byas te mtha' gcig tu 'dug go /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rta thul dang lhan cig mngon du yang dag par dga' bar 'gyur ba dang / yang dag par mgu bar 'gyur ba'i gtam sna tshogs byas te mtha' gcig tu 'dug go /
translated: sat down in one place.

original: mtha' gcig tu 'dug nas gyad bu nor gyis tshe dang ldan pa rta thul la 'di skad ces smras so //🔽shes ldan ci khyod ston @371b pa lags sam /
analyzed: mtha' gcig tu 'dug nas gyad bu nor gyis tshe dang ldan pa rta thul la 'di skad ces smras so // shes ldan ci khyod ston @371b pa lags sam /
translated: Seated to one side, Ghoṣila asked the Venerable Aśvajit,

original: 'on te nyan thos lags /
analyzed: 'on te nyan thos lags /
translated: “Sir, are you a teacher or a disciple?”

original: bzhin bzang kho bo ni nyan thos ston pa'i lam gyi rjes su zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: bzhin bzang kho bo ni nyan thos ston pa'i lam gyi rjes su zhugs pa yin no //
translated: “Good man, I am a disciple who follows the path taught by the Teacher.”

original: shes ldan ston pa dang / nyan thos la khyad par ci mchis /
analyzed: shes ldan ston pa dang / nyan thos la khyad par ci mchis /
translated: “Sir, what is the difference between a teacher and a disciple?”

original: bzhin bzang khyad par shin tu che ste /
analyzed: bzhin bzang khyad par shin tu che ste /
translated: “Good man, the difference is very great.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na ri'i rgyal po ri rab dang / yungs kar lta bu dang / rgya mtsho chen po dang / ba lang gi rjes lta bu dang / nyi ma dang / srin bu me khyer lta bu dang / nam mkha' dang / padma'i rtsa ba'i bu ga lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na ri'i rgyal po ri rab dang / yungs kar lta bu dang / rgya mtsho chen po dang / ba lang gi rjes lta bu dang / nyi ma dang / srin bu me khyer lta bu dang / nam mkha' dang / padma'i rtsa ba'i bu ga lta bu'o //
translated: Mount Sumeru and a mustard seed, the great ocean and a cow’s footprint, the sun and a firefly, space and the hole of a needle.”

original: de la ri'i rgyal po ri rab ci lta ba de ltar ni ston pa blta bar bya la /
analyzed: de la ri'i rgyal po ri rab ci lta ba de ltar ni ston pa blta bar bya la /
translated: “As for Mount Sumeru, you should regard it as the Teacher;

original: yungs kar ji lta ba de ltar ni nyan thos blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: yungs kar ji lta ba de ltar ni nyan thos blta bar bya'o //
translated: as for the mustard seed, you should regard it as a disciple.”

original: rgya mtsho chen po ji lta ba de ltar ni ston pa blta bar bya la /
analyzed: rgya mtsho chen po ji lta ba de ltar ni ston pa blta bar bya la /
translated: The teacher should be seen as like the great ocean,

original: ba lang gi rjes ji lta ba de ltar ni nyan thos blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ba lang gi rjes ji lta ba de ltar ni nyan thos blta bar bya'o //
translated: and the śrāvakas as like a cow’s hoofprint.

original: nyi ma ji lta ba de ltar ni ston pa blta bar bya la /
analyzed: nyi ma ji lta ba de ltar ni ston pa blta bar bya la /
translated: The teacher should be seen as like the sun,

original: srin bu me khyer ji lta ba de ltar ni nyan thos blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: srin bu me khyer ji lta ba de ltar ni nyan thos blta bar bya'o //
translated: and the śrāvakas as like fireflies.

original: nam mkha' ji lta ba de ltar ni ston pa blta bar bya la /
analyzed: nam mkha' ji lta ba de ltar ni ston pa blta bar bya la /
translated: The teacher should be seen as like space,

original: padma'i rtsa ba'i bu ga ji lta ba de ltar ni nyan thos blta bar bya'o zhes smras nas /
analyzed: padma'i rtsa ba'i bu ga ji lta ba de ltar ni nyan thos blta bar bya'o zhes smras nas /
translated: and the śrāvakas as like the hole in a lotus root.”

original: tshigs su bcad pa smras pa /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa smras pa /
translated: Then he spoke these verses:🔽What is the difference between the king of mountains and a mustard seed?

original: ri rgyal yungs kar gnyis la khyad par gang yod dang // dug can glang rjes chu la khyad par gang yod dang // nyi ma me khyer srin la khyad par gang yod pa //
analyzed: ri rgyal yungs kar gnyis la khyad par gang yod dang // dug can glang rjes chu la khyad par gang yod dang // nyi ma me khyer srin la khyad par gang yod pa //
translated: What is the difference between the water in a cow’s hoofprint and a poisonous snake?🔽What is the difference between the sun and a firefly?

original: nam mkha' padma'i bu gar khyad par gang yod pa //
analyzed: nam mkha' padma'i bu gar khyad par gang yod pa //
translated: What is the difference between space and the hole in a lotus root?

original: sangs rgyas nyan thos byang chub khyad par de yod do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyan thos byang chub khyad par de yod do //
translated: That is the difference between the Buddha and the śrāvakas.

original: de nas gyad bu nor 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de nas gyad bu nor 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then, the son of Gyad, Norbu, thought this:

original: ji ltar rab tu byung ba 'di'i ston pa la bstod par byed cing /
analyzed: ji ltar rab tu byung ba 'di'i ston pa la bstod par byed cing /
translated: “Since he praises his teacher and🔽deprecates himself,

original: bdag nyid la smad par @372a *//🔽byed pa las na /
analyzed: bdag nyid la smad par @372a *// byed pa las na /
translated: I know that

original: sangs rgyas ni dam pa ma yin par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni dam pa ma yin par mi 'gyur la /
translated: the Buddha is not false,

original: chos bstan pa yang dam pa ma yin par mi 'gyur ro snyam du rig nas /
analyzed: chos bstan pa yang dam pa ma yin par mi 'gyur ro snyam du rig nas /
translated: and the teaching of the Dharma is not false.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa rta thul la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rta thul la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: He said to the Venerable Aśvajit,🔽“Noble one, I wish to go forth in the well-taught Dharma and Vinaya,

original: 'phags pa bdag legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu 'byung ba dang / bsnyen par rdzogs pa dge slong gi dngos po thob par bgyi'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa bdag legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu 'byung ba dang / bsnyen par rdzogs pa dge slong gi dngos po thob par bgyi'o //
translated: and to obtain the state of a fully ordained monk.

original: bdag 'phags pa'i drung du tshangs par spyod pa spyad par bgyi'o //
analyzed: bdag 'phags pa'i drung du tshangs par spyod pa spyad par bgyi'o //
translated: I wish to practice pure conduct in the presence of the noble one.”

original: bzhin bzang khyod pha ma dag gis gnang ngam /
analyzed: bzhin bzang khyod pha ma dag gis gnang ngam /
translated: “Good-looking man, have your parents given their permission?”

original: 'phags pa / ma gnang ngo //
analyzed: 'phags pa / ma gnang ngo //
translated: “Noble one, they have not.”

original: bzhin bzang de bzhin gshegs pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos ni pha ma dag gis ma gnang ba'i rigs kyi bu rab tu 'byin par mi mdzad /
analyzed: bzhin bzang de bzhin gshegs pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos ni pha ma dag gis ma gnang ba'i rigs kyi bu rab tu 'byin par mi mdzad /
translated: “Good man, the Tathāgata and the Tathāgata’s disciples do not give the going forth to a son of family who has not been given permission by his parents.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs par mi mdzad do //
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs par mi mdzad do //
translated: They do not give the higher ordination.

original: 'phags pa khyod kyis bdag rab tu dbyung ba 'ba' zhig mdzod cig dang / ci nas kyang bdag pha ma dag gis gnang bar 'gyur ba de ltar bdag bgyid do //
analyzed: 'phags pa khyod kyis bdag rab tu dbyung ba 'ba' zhig mdzod cig dang / ci nas kyang bdag pha ma dag gis gnang bar 'gyur ba de ltar bdag bgyid do //
translated: Noble one, please just give me the going forth and I will do whatever it takes to get my parents’ permission.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa rta thul gyis de la bzhin bzang legs kyis de ltar byos shig ces smras so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rta thul gyis de la bzhin bzang legs kyis de ltar byos shig ces smras so //
translated: The venerable Aśvajit said to him, “Good man, that is excellent. Do it that way.”

original: de nas gyad bu nor gyis tshe dang ldan pa rta thul gyis smras pa la mngon par bstod pa byas shing rjes su yi rangs ba byas nas rang gi khyim ga la ba der stong ste phyin nas /🔽pha ma gnyis la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas gyad bu nor gyis tshe dang ldan pa rta thul gyis smras pa la mngon par bstod pa byas shing rjes su yi rangs ba byas nas rang gi khyim ga la ba der stong ste phyin nas / pha ma gnyis la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then Yajñagupta praised and rejoiced in what the venerable Aśvajit had said. He went to his own house and said to his parents:

original: yab yum mkhyen par mdzod cig /
analyzed: yab yum mkhyen par mdzod cig /
translated: “Father, Mother, please know this.

original: bdag legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la yang dag pa @372b kho nar dad pas khyim nas khyim med par rab tu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bdag legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la yang dag pa @372b kho nar dad pas khyim nas khyim med par rab tu 'byung ngo //
translated: I will go forth from home into homelessness in the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya.”

original: bu gzhon nu shes par gyis shig /
analyzed: bu gzhon nu shes par gyis shig /
translated: “Son, young man, understand this:

original: khyod nged kyi bu gcig pa sdug pa yid du 'ong ba bzod pa mthong na mi mthun pa med pa yin pas /
analyzed: khyod nged kyi bu gcig pa sdug pa yid du 'ong ba bzod pa mthong na mi mthun pa med pa yin pas /
translated: You are our only son, dear and beloved, never displeasing to us.

original: khyod shi bar gyur na nged mi 'dod bzhin du 'bral ba kho na yin gyis /
analyzed: khyod shi bar gyur na nged mi 'dod bzhin du 'bral ba kho na yin gyis /
translated: If you were to die, we would be separated against our will.

original: gson bzhin du btang ba lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: gson bzhin du btang ba lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: What need is there to speak of sending you away while you are still alive?

original: yab yum gal te gnang na de lta na legs /
analyzed: yab yum gal te gnang na de lta na legs /
translated: “Father, Mother, if you allow it, that would be good.

original: gal te ma gnang na deng slan chad 'tshal ma yang mi 'tshal /
analyzed: gal te ma gnang na deng slan chad 'tshal ma yang mi 'tshal /
translated: If you do not allow it, from now on I will not eat,

original: phyag kyang mi 'tshal lo //
analyzed: phyag kyang mi 'tshal lo //
translated: and I will not salute you.”

original: bu gzhon nu mi gnang gis ji srid nged gson gyi bar du khyod nged kyi mig lam na 'dug la bya ba gzhan ma sems shig /
analyzed: bu gzhon nu mi gnang gis ji srid nged gson gyi bar du khyod nged kyi mig lam na 'dug la bya ba gzhan ma sems shig /
translated: “Son, young man, we do not allow it. As long as we are alive, stay in our sight and do not think of anything else.”

original: de nas gyad bu nor gyis nyi ma gcig kyang zan bcad pa byas so //
analyzed: de nas gyad bu nor gyis nyi ma gcig kyang zan bcad pa byas so //
translated: Then, for one day, Jyotiṣka fasted.

original: gnyis pa dang gsum nas drug gi bar du yang zan bcad pa byas so //
analyzed: gnyis pa dang gsum nas drug gi bar du yang zan bcad pa byas so //
translated: He fasted for a second and a third time, up to a sixth time.

original: de nas gyad bu nor gyi pha ma gnyis kyis gyad bu nor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas gyad bu nor gyi pha ma gnyis kyis gyad bu nor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then Jyotiṣka’s parents said to him,

original: bu gzhon nu shes par gyis shig /
analyzed: bu gzhon nu shes par gyis shig /
translated: “Son, young man, you should know this:

original: khyod ni shin tu gzhon pa bde ba 'dod pa yin pas /
analyzed: khyod ni shin tu gzhon pa bde ba 'dod pa yin pas /
translated: You are very young and desire happiness.

original: khyod kyis sdug bsngal mi shes te /
analyzed: khyod kyis sdug bsngal mi shes te /
translated: You do not know suffering.

original: tshangs par spyod pa spyad dka'o //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa spyad dka'o //
translated: It is difficult to practice pure conduct.

original: rab tu dben pa bya dka'o //
analyzed: rab tu dben pa bya dka'o //
translated: It is difficult to be secluded.

original: gcig pu nyid la mngon par dga' bar dka' ba'o //
analyzed: gcig pu nyid la mngon par dga' bar dka' ba'o //
translated: It is difficult to delight in being alone.

original: gnas mal dgon pa nags khrod dang ri drung dang bas mtha' dag tu gnas pa khong du chud pa dka'o //
analyzed: gnas mal dgon pa nags khrod dang ri drung dang bas mtha' dag tu gnas pa khong du chud pa dka'o //
translated: It is difficult to understand living in remote wilderness areas, at the foot of mountains, or in isolated forests.

original: gcig pu dgon par gnas pa sdug bsngal lo //🔽khyod kyis ji srid 'tsho'i bar du ri dvags gdug pa dag dang lhan cig gnas par bya dgos so //
analyzed: gcig pu dgon par gnas pa sdug bsngal lo // khyod kyis ji srid 'tsho'i bar du ri dvags gdug pa dag dang lhan cig gnas par bya dgos so //
translated: Living alone in the wilderness is suffering.🔽For as long as you live, you will have to live with wild animals.

original: khyod @373a *// kyis ji srid 'tsho'i bar du gzhan gyis byin pas 'tsho bar bya dgos so //
analyzed: khyod @373a *// kyis ji srid 'tsho'i bar du gzhan gyis byin pas 'tsho bar bya dgos so //
translated: For as long as you live, you will have to live on what others give you.

original: khyod kyis ji srid 'tsho'i bar du mi'i 'dod pa dag las dben par bya dgos so //
analyzed: khyod kyis ji srid 'tsho'i bar du mi'i 'dod pa dag las dben par bya dgos so //
translated: You must remain apart from human desires for as long as you live.

original: khyod kyis ji srid 'tsho'i bar du mi'i dga' ba dang rtsed mo dag las dben par bya dgos so //
analyzed: khyod kyis ji srid 'tsho'i bar du mi'i dga' ba dang rtsed mo dag las dben par bya dgos so //
translated: You must remain apart from human pleasures and games for as long as you live.

original: gzhon nu tshur shog /
analyzed: gzhon nu tshur shog /
translated: Young man, come here!

original: 'dug la 'dod pa dag la yongs su spyod cig /
analyzed: 'dug la 'dod pa dag la yongs su spyod cig /
translated: Sit down and enjoy the pleasures.

original: sbyin pa dag kyang byin cig /
analyzed: sbyin pa dag kyang byin cig /
translated: Give gifts.

original: bsod nams dag kyang gyis shig /
analyzed: bsod nams dag kyang gyis shig /
translated: Make merit.

original: de skad smras kyang gyad bu nor cang mi smra'o //
analyzed: de skad smras kyang gyad bu nor cang mi smra'o //
translated: But despite their words, Jyotiṣka remained silent.

original: de nas gyad bu nor gyi pha ma gnyis kyis nye du rnams la bsgo ba /
analyzed: de nas gyad bu nor gyi pha ma gnyis kyis nye du rnams la bsgo ba /
translated: Then Jyotiṣka’s parents said to their relatives,

original: kye nye du dag tshur sheg bu gzhon nu gyad bu nor slongs shig /🔽de nas gyad bu nor gyi nye du dag gyad bu nor ga la ba der dong ste phyin nas /
analyzed: kye nye du dag tshur sheg bu gzhon nu gyad bu nor slongs shig / de nas gyad bu nor gyi nye du dag gyad bu nor ga la ba der dong ste phyin nas /
translated: “Come, relatives, ask our young son Jyotiṣka.”

original: gyad bu nor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: gyad bu nor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then Jyotiṣka’s relatives went to Jyotiṣka and said to him,

original: sras gzhon nu mkhyen par mdzod cig /
analyzed: sras gzhon nu mkhyen par mdzod cig /
translated: “Son, listen.

original: khyod ni shin tu gzhon pa bde ba bzhed pa lags pas khyod kyis sdug bsngal mi mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyod ni shin tu gzhon pa bde ba bzhed pa lags pas khyod kyis sdug bsngal mi mkhyen te /
translated: You are very young and desire happiness, so you do not know suffering.

original: tshangs par spyod pa spyad dka'o //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa spyad dka'o //
translated: It is difficult to practice pure conduct.

original: rab tu dben pa bgyid dka'o //
analyzed: rab tu dben pa bgyid dka'o //
translated: It is difficult to be secluded.

original: gcig pu nyid la mngon par dga' bar dka'o //
analyzed: gcig pu nyid la mngon par dga' bar dka'o //
translated: It is difficult to delight in being alone.

original: gnas mal dgon pa nags khrod dang ri drung dang bas mtha' dag tu gnas pa khong du chud par dka'o //
analyzed: gnas mal dgon pa nags khrod dang ri drung dang bas mtha' dag tu gnas pa khong du chud par dka'o //
translated: It is difficult to understand dwelling in a solitary place, in the forest, at the foot of a mountain, or in the wilderness.

original: gcig pu dgon par gnas pa sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: gcig pu dgon par gnas pa sdug bsngal lo //
translated: Dwelling alone in a solitary place is suffering.

original: khyod kyis ji srid 'tsho'i bar du ri dvags gdug pa dag dang lhan cig gnas par bgyi 'tshal lo //
analyzed: khyod kyis ji srid 'tsho'i bar du ri dvags gdug pa dag dang lhan cig gnas par bgyi 'tshal lo //
translated: For as long as you live, you should dwell together with wild animals.

original: khyod kyis ji srid 'tsho'i bar du gzhan gyis byin pas 'tsho bar bgyi 'tshal lo //🔽khyod kyis ji srid 'tsho'i bar du mi'i 'dod @373b pa dag las dben par bgyi 'tshal lo //
analyzed: khyod kyis ji srid 'tsho'i bar du gzhan gyis byin pas 'tsho bar bgyi 'tshal lo // khyod kyis ji srid 'tsho'i bar du mi'i 'dod @373b pa dag las dben par bgyi 'tshal lo //
translated: For as long as you live, you should live by what others give.🔽For as long as you live, you should be secluded from human desires.

original: khyod kyis ji srid 'tsho'i bar du mi'i dga' ba dang rtsed mo dag las dben par bgyi 'tshal lo //
analyzed: khyod kyis ji srid 'tsho'i bar du mi'i dga' ba dang rtsed mo dag las dben par bgyi 'tshal lo //
translated: For as long as you live, you should be secluded from human pleasures and amusements.

original: sras gzhon nu tshur spyon /
analyzed: sras gzhon nu tshur spyon /
translated: “Come back, young man!

original: bzhugs la 'dod pa dag la yang yongs su spyod cig /
analyzed: bzhugs la 'dod pa dag la yang yongs su spyod cig /
translated: Stay and enjoy the pleasures of desire.

original: sbyin pa dag kyang stsol cig /
analyzed: sbyin pa dag kyang stsol cig /
translated: Give gifts.

original: bsod nams dag kyang mdzod cig /
analyzed: bsod nams dag kyang mdzod cig /
translated: Make merit.

original: de skad smras kyang gyad bu nor cang mi smra'o //
analyzed: de skad smras kyang gyad bu nor cang mi smra'o //
translated: ” But despite their entreaties, Jyotiṣka remained silent.

original: de nas gyad bu nor gyi pha ma gnyis kyis gyad bu nor gyi ne'u ldangs rnams la bsgo ba /
analyzed: de nas gyad bu nor gyi pha ma gnyis kyis gyad bu nor gyi ne'u ldangs rnams la bsgo ba /
translated: Then Jyotiṣka’s parents said to his friends,

original: kye gzhon nu dag tshur sheg bu gzhon nu gyad bu nor slongs shig /🔽de nas gyad bu nor gyi ne'u ldangs dag kyang gyad bu nor ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
analyzed: kye gzhon nu dag tshur sheg bu gzhon nu gyad bu nor slongs shig / de nas gyad bu nor gyi ne'u ldangs dag kyang gyad bu nor ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
translated: “Young men, go and fetch the young man Jyotiṣka.”

original: gyad bu nor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: gyad bu nor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then Jyotiṣka’s friends went to Jyotiṣka and said,

original: sras gzhon nu mkhyen par mdzod cig /
analyzed: sras gzhon nu mkhyen par mdzod cig /
translated: “Young man, you must know this.

original: khyod ni shin tu gzhon pa bde ba bzhed pa lags pas khyod kyis sdug bsngal mi mkhyen te /
analyzed: khyod ni shin tu gzhon pa bde ba bzhed pa lags pas khyod kyis sdug bsngal mi mkhyen te /
translated: You are very young and want to be happy, so you do not know what suffering is.

original: tshangs par spyod pa spyad dka'o //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa spyad dka'o //
translated: It is difficult to practice pure conduct.

original: rab tu dben pa bgyi dka'o //
analyzed: rab tu dben pa bgyi dka'o //
translated: It is difficult to be secluded.

original: gcig pu nyid la mngon par dga' bar dka'o //
analyzed: gcig pu nyid la mngon par dga' bar dka'o //
translated: It is difficult to delight in being alone.

original: gnas mal dgon pa nags khrod dang ri drung dang bas mtha' dag tu gnas par khong du chud par dka'o //
analyzed: gnas mal dgon pa nags khrod dang ri drung dang bas mtha' dag tu gnas par khong du chud par dka'o //
translated: It is difficult to understand that one should live in a monastery, in the forest, at the foot of a tree, in a charnel ground, in the open air, or in a hermitage.

original: gcig pu dgon par gnas pa sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: gcig pu dgon par gnas pa sdug bsngal lo //
translated: It is painful to live alone in the forest.

original: khyod kyis ji srid 'tsho'i bar du ri dvags gdug pa dag dang lhan cig gnas par bgyi 'tshal lo //
analyzed: khyod kyis ji srid 'tsho'i bar du ri dvags gdug pa dag dang lhan cig gnas par bgyi 'tshal lo //
translated: You should live with wild animals for as long as you live.

original: khyod kyis ji srid 'tsho'i bar du gzhan gyis byin pas 'tsho bar bgyi 'tshal lo //🔽khyod kyis ji srid 'tsho'i bar du mi'i 'dod pa dag las dben par bgyi 'tshal lo //
analyzed: khyod kyis ji srid 'tsho'i bar du gzhan gyis byin pas 'tsho bar bgyi 'tshal lo // khyod kyis ji srid 'tsho'i bar du mi'i 'dod pa dag las dben par bgyi 'tshal lo //
translated: You should live on what others give you for as long as you live.🔽You should be free from human desires for as long as you live.

original: khyod kyis ji srid 'tsho'i bar du mi'i dga' ba dang rtse mo dag las dben par bgyi @374a *//
analyzed: khyod kyis ji srid 'tsho'i bar du mi'i dga' ba dang rtse mo dag las dben par bgyi @374a *//
translated: You should be free from human pleasures and amusements for as long as you live.

original: 'tshal lo // sras gzhon nu tshur spyon /
analyzed: 'tshal lo // sras gzhon nu tshur spyon /
translated: Come, young prince,

original: bzhugs la 'dod pa dag la yang yongs su spyod cig //
analyzed: bzhugs la 'dod pa dag la yang yongs su spyod cig //
translated: sit down and enjoy the pleasures of love.

original: sbyin pa dag kyang stsol cig /
analyzed: sbyin pa dag kyang stsol cig /
translated: Give gifts.

original: bsod nams dag kyang mdzod cig /
analyzed: bsod nams dag kyang mdzod cig /
translated: Make merit.

original: de skad smras kyang gyad bu nor cang mi smra'o //
analyzed: de skad smras kyang gyad bu nor cang mi smra'o //
translated: But despite this, Jyotiṣka remained silent.

original: de nas gyad bu nor gyi ne'u ldangs rnams gyad bu nor gyi pha ma gnyis ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
analyzed: de nas gyad bu nor gyi ne'u ldangs rnams gyad bu nor gyi pha ma gnyis ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
translated: Then the young men of Nyagrodha went to the parents of Nyagrodha and said,

original: gyad bu nor gyi pha ma gnyis la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: gyad bu nor gyi pha ma gnyis la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the young men of the Śākya clan went to the parents of Upatiṣya and said:

original: yab yum dag mkhyen par mdzod cig /
analyzed: yab yum dag mkhyen par mdzod cig /
translated: “Father and Mother, please listen!

original: zhi ba gzhon nu gum pas ci zhig bgyi /
analyzed: zhi ba gzhon nu gum pas ci zhig bgyi /
translated: What is to be done with the dead Śāriputra?

original: rab tu byung ba ni mkhas pas bsngags pa lags pas gal te rab tu byung nas mngon par dga' bar gyur na yang de gson po nyid du gzigs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba ni mkhas pas bsngags pa lags pas gal te rab tu byung nas mngon par dga' bar gyur na yang de gson po nyid du gzigs par 'gyur la /
translated: Since going forth is praised by the wise, if he were to go forth and find joy in it, you would see him alive.

original: mngon par dga' bar ma gyur na yang /
analyzed: mngon par dga' bar ma gyur na yang /
translated: If he does not find joy in it,

original: drang srong dag ni slar ldog pa lags pas bu'i gnas pha ma gnyis ma gtogs pa gzhan su zhig mchis par 'gyur gyis rab tu byung na legs so //
analyzed: drang srong dag ni slar ldog pa lags pas bu'i gnas pha ma gnyis ma gtogs pa gzhan su zhig mchis par 'gyur gyis rab tu byung na legs so //
translated: since sages can return, who else would be his refuge but you, his parents? It would be good if he went forth.”

original: de nas gyad bu nor gyi pha ma gnyis kyis gyad bu nor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas gyad bu nor gyi pha ma gnyis kyis gyad bu nor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the parents of Upatiṣya said to him, “Son, it would be good if you went forth.”

original: bu gzhon nu khyod la rab tu 'byung ba legs par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: bu gzhon nu khyod la rab tu 'byung ba legs par byed pa yin la /
translated: “Son, it would be good if you went forth.”

original: khyim na gnas pa legs par byed pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: khyim na gnas pa legs par byed pa ma yin nam /
translated: “Is it not good to live in a house?”

original: yab yum bdag la rab tu 'byung ba legs pa bgyid pa lags la /
analyzed: yab yum bdag la rab tu 'byung ba legs pa bgyid pa lags la /
translated: “Father, Mother, it is good to go forth,

original: khyim na gnas pa legs par bgyid pa ma lags so //
analyzed: khyim na gnas pa legs par bgyid pa ma lags so //
translated: but it is not good to live in a house.”

original: bu gzhon nu da de'i dus la bab par shes par gyis shig /
analyzed: bu gzhon nu da de'i dus la bab par shes par gyis shig /
translated: “Son, young man, know that the time has come.”

original: de nas gyad bu nor pha ma gnyis gyis gnang nas 'bras khu'i rim gyis @374b lus kyi mthu dang stobs dang / brtson 'grus bskyed de /
analyzed: de nas gyad bu nor pha ma gnyis gyis gnang nas 'bras khu'i rim gyis @374b lus kyi mthu dang stobs dang / brtson 'grus bskyed de /
translated: Then, with his parents’ permission, with a series of rice gruels, he built up his body’s strength, energy, and perseverance.

original: sdig byung nas phyir byung nas tshe dang ldan pa rta thul ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
analyzed: sdig byung nas phyir byung nas tshe dang ldan pa rta thul ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
translated: After he had recovered, he went to where the venerable Aśvajit was.

original: tshe dang ldan pa rta thul gyi rkang pa gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te mtha' gcig tu 'dug go /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rta thul gyi rkang pa gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te mtha' gcig tu 'dug go /
translated: When he arrived, he bowed his head at the feet of the venerable Aśvajit and sat to one side.

original: mtha' gcig tu 'dug nas gyad bu nor gyis tshe dang ldan pa rta thul la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: mtha' gcig tu 'dug nas gyad bu nor gyis tshe dang ldan pa rta thul la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: When he had sat to one side, the young man Kolita said to the venerable Aśvajit,

original: 'phags pa mkhyen par mdzod cig /
analyzed: 'phags pa mkhyen par mdzod cig /
translated: “Noble one, please listen.

original: bdag pha ma gnyis kyis gnang gis bdag legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu 'byung ba dang / bsnyen par rdzogs pa dge slong gi dngos po thob par bgyi'o //
analyzed: bdag pha ma gnyis kyis gnang gis bdag legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu 'byung ba dang / bsnyen par rdzogs pa dge slong gi dngos po thob par bgyi'o //
translated: “Father and mother, please give me permission. I will go forth in the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya and achieve the state of a monk.

original: bdag 'phags pa'i drung na tshangs par spyod pa spyad par bgyi'o //
analyzed: bdag 'phags pa'i drung na tshangs par spyod pa spyad par bgyi'o //
translated: I will practice pure conduct in the presence of the noble ones.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa rta thul gyis smras pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rta thul gyis smras pa /
translated: Venerable Aśvajit said,

original: bzhin bzang legs so //
analyzed: bzhin bzang legs so //
translated: “Good man, that is excellent.

original: longs spyod dag ni mi rtag pa yin na rab tu 'byung ba ni legs pa yin gyis de ltar gyis shig /
analyzed: longs spyod dag ni mi rtag pa yin na rab tu 'byung ba ni legs pa yin gyis de ltar gyis shig /
translated: Since enjoyments are impermanent, going forth is good. Do that.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang phan yon lnga yang dag par rjes su mthong ba'i mkhas pas rab tu 'byung ba la mos par bya ba kho nar rigs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang phan yon lnga yang dag par rjes su mthong ba'i mkhas pas rab tu 'byung ba la mos par bya ba kho nar rigs te /
translated: The Blessed One also said, “The wise, who see the five benefits, should only aspire to go forth.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: bdag gis rang gi don ma 'dres pa rjes su thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mthong ba'i mkhas pas rab tu 'byung ba la mos par bya ba kho nar rigs pa dang / bdag gang dag gi bran dang / mngag gzhug dang /
analyzed: bdag gis rang gi don ma 'dres pa rjes su thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mthong ba'i mkhas pas rab tu 'byung ba la mos par bya ba kho nar rigs pa dang / bdag gang dag gi bran dang / mngag gzhug dang /
translated: The wise one who sees that he will attain his own goal in a pure way should only aspire to go forth.

original: bsgo ba dang / rang dbang med pa dang / dga' mgur 'gror med pa yin pa de dag gi mchod par bya ba dang / bstod par bya bar 'gyur ro zhes yang dag par rjes su mthong ba'i mkhas pas rab @375a *//
analyzed: bsgo ba dang / rang dbang med pa dang / dga' mgur 'gror med pa yin pa de dag gi mchod par bya ba dang / bstod par bya bar 'gyur ro zhes yang dag par rjes su mthong ba'i mkhas pas rab @375a *//
translated: The wise one who sees that he will become an object of worship and praise for those who are servants, messengers,🔽and slaves who are not their own masters and who cannot go where they wish should only aspire to go forth.

original: tu 'byung ba la mos par bya ba kho nar rigs pa dang / grub pa dang bde ba bla na med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mthong ba'i mkhas pas rab tu 'byung ba la mos par bya ba kho nar rigs pa dang /
analyzed: tu 'byung ba la mos par bya ba kho nar rigs pa dang / grub pa dang bde ba bla na med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mthong ba'i mkhas pas rab tu 'byung ba la mos par bya ba kho nar rigs pa dang /
translated: The wise one who sees that he will attain the unsurpassed bliss of nirvana should only aspire to go forth.

original: grub pa dang bde ba bla na med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa las nyams na yang lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mthong ba'i mkhas pas rab tu 'byung ba la mos par bya ba kho
analyzed: grub pa dang bde ba bla na med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa las nyams na yang lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mthong ba'i mkhas pas rab tu 'byung ba la mos par bya ba kho
translated: Even if you were to fall from the attainment of the unsurpassed transcendence of suffering, you would still be reborn among the gods.”🔽The wise who see this should aspire to go forth.

original: nar rigs pa dang / rab tu byung ba ni sangs rgyas rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos dam pa yang dag par rtogs pa /
analyzed: nar rigs pa dang / rab tu byung ba ni sangs rgyas rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos dam pa yang dag par rtogs pa /
translated: “ ‘Going forth is praised in many ways by the buddhas, the sublime hearers of the buddhas,

original: yang dag par sgrub pa /
analyzed: yang dag par sgrub pa /
translated: those who have realized the truth,🔽and the holy beings.🔽The wise who see this should aspire to go forth.

original: skyes bu dam pa rnams kyis rnam grang du mas bsngags so zhes yang dag par rjes su mthong ba'i mkhas pas rab tu 'byung ba la mos par bya ba kho nar rigs so zhes gsungs kyis rab tu byung zhig /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa rnams kyis rnam grang du mas bsngags so zhes yang dag par rjes su mthong ba'i mkhas pas rab tu 'byung ba la mos par bya ba kho nar rigs so zhes gsungs kyis rab tu byung zhig /
translated: “ ‘Go forth, then.’

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rta thul gyis rigs kyi bu gyad bu nor rab tu phyung ba snyen par rdzogs par byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rta thul gyis rigs kyi bu gyad bu nor rab tu phyung ba snyen par rdzogs par byas nas smras pa /
translated: “The venerable Aśvajit then gave the noble son Ghaṭikāra ordination and said,

original: bu dge slong gi las ni gnyis te /
analyzed: bu dge slong gi las ni gnyis te /
translated: “Son, a monk’s work is twofold:

original: bsam gtan dang / klog pa yin na /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / klog pa yin na /
translated: meditation and study.

original: khyod bsam gtan dang / klog pa gang 'dod /🔽gyad bu nor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: khyod bsam gtan dang / klog pa gang 'dod / gyad bu nor gyis smras pa /
translated: Which do you prefer?”

original: mkhan po gnyis ka yang bgyi ste /
analyzed: mkhan po gnyis ka yang bgyi ste /
translated: “Preceptor, I will do both.

original: gdugs la ni klog par bgyi /
analyzed: gdugs la ni klog par bgyi /
translated: During the day I will study,

original: dgung la ni bsam gtan bgyi'o //🔽tshe dang ldan pa rta thul gyis smras pa /
analyzed: dgung la ni bsam gtan bgyi'o // tshe dang ldan pa rta thul gyis smras pa /
translated: and at night I will meditate.”

original: bu de bzhin gyis shig /
analyzed: bu de bzhin gyis shig /
translated: “Son, do as you wish.”

original: de nas @375b tshe dang ldan pa gyad bu nor gyis nyin mo klog pa dang kha ton byas pas sde snod gsum po dag lhogs par gyur to //
analyzed: de nas @375b tshe dang ldan pa gyad bu nor gyis nyin mo klog pa dang kha ton byas pas sde snod gsum po dag lhogs par gyur to //
translated: Then the venerable Upasena studied during the day and recited the scriptures by heart. He became a master of the Tripiṭaka.

original: mtshan mo bsam gtan byas pas gong nas gong du yid la byed pa'i khyad par thob nas 'khor ba'i 'khor lo cha lnga pa g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba 'di nyid rig ste /
analyzed: mtshan mo bsam gtan byas pas gong nas gong du yid la byed pa'i khyad par thob nas 'khor ba'i 'khor lo cha lnga pa g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba 'di nyid rig ste /
translated: At night he meditated and attained the special mental states. He understood this very revolving wheel of five parts of saṃsāra, moving and unmoving.

original: 'du byed kyi rnam pa thams cad nyams pa dang ltung ba dang rnam par 'thor ba dang rnam par 'jig pa'i chos nyid kyi zil gyis mnan nas /🔽nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas rigs kyi bu dag gang gi phyir skra dang kha sbu bregs te gos ngur smrig dag bgos nas /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rnam pa thams cad nyams pa dang ltung ba dang rnam par 'thor ba dang rnam par 'jig pa'i chos nyid kyi zil gyis mnan nas / nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas rigs kyi bu dag gang gi phyir skra dang kha sbu bregs te gos ngur smrig dag bgos nas /
translated: All conditioned things are overcome by the nature of decline, fall, dispersal, and destruction.🔽Sons of noble family, those who shave their heads and beards, don the saffron-colored robes,

original: yang dag pa kho nar dad pas khyim nas khyim med par rab tu 'byung bar byed pa tshangs par spyod pa'i mtha' bla na med pa de /
analyzed: yang dag pa kho nar dad pas khyim nas khyim med par rab tu 'byung bar byed pa tshangs par spyod pa'i mtha' bla na med pa de /
translated: and go forth from the household to become renunciants, in order to attain the unsurpassed, complete pacification of all afflictions,🔽will in this very life actualize and accomplish the unsurpassed, complete pacification of all afflictions through supernormal knowledge.

original: tshe de nyid la rab tu mngon par shes pas mngon sum du byas te bsgrubs nas bdag gi skye ba zad do; ;tshangs par spyod pa spyad do //
analyzed: tshe de nyid la rab tu mngon par shes pas mngon sum du byas te bsgrubs nas bdag gi skye ba zad do; ;tshangs par spyod pa spyad do //
translated: They will understand, ‘My births have come to an end. I have lived the holy life.

original: bya ba byas so //
analyzed: bya ba byas so //
translated: I have done what needed to be done.

original: srid pa 'di las gzhan mi shes so zhes go bar byed cing /
analyzed: srid pa 'di las gzhan mi shes so zhes go bar byed cing /
translated: I will know no other lives than this one.’

original: dgra bcom pa khams gsum pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa khams gsum pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba /
translated: They will become arhats free from attachment to the three realms,

original: bong ba dang gser du mnyam pa /
analyzed: bong ba dang gser du mnyam pa /
translated: equal toward gold and filth,

original: nam mkha' dang lag mthil du mtshungs pa'i sems dang ldan pa /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang lag mthil du mtshungs pa'i sems dang ldan pa /
translated: His mind was like the sky and the palm of his hand.

original: tsan dan bzhag pa lta bu /
analyzed: tsan dan bzhag pa lta bu /
translated: He was like a sandalwood tree.

original: rig pas sgo nga'i sbubs dral bar gyur cing rig pa dang mngon par shes pa dang so so yang dag par rig pa thob bo //
analyzed: rig pas sgo nga'i sbubs dral bar gyur cing rig pa dang mngon par shes pa dang so so yang dag par rig pa thob bo //
translated: He had broken through the shell of ignorance with the vajra of knowledge, and had attained knowledge, higher knowledge, and discriminations.

original: srid pa dang 'dod pa'i rnyed pa dang bkur sti la rgyab kyis phyogs pa /
analyzed: srid pa dang 'dod pa'i rnyed pa dang bkur sti la rgyab kyis phyogs pa /
translated: He had turned his back on the world and on the gains, honors, and fame of the desire realm.

original: dbang po dang nye dbang dang bcas pa'i lha rnams kyis mchod @376a *//🔽par bya ba dang / rjed par bya ba dang / mngon du smra bar gyur to ////
analyzed: dbang po dang nye dbang dang bcas pa'i lha rnams kyis mchod @376a *// par bya ba dang / rjed par bya ba dang / mngon du smra bar gyur to ////
translated: He was worshipped, revered, and honored by Indra, Upendra, and the gods.

original: 'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa /
analyzed: 'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa /
translated: This is the chapter on the analysis of the Vinaya.

original: bam po nyi shu pa /
analyzed: bam po nyi shu pa /
translated: Chapter 20

original: ji ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gson zhing bzhugs te /
analyzed: ji ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gson zhing bzhugs te /
translated: Just as the Blessed Buddhas, while alive,

original: 'tsho zhing gzhes pa rnams la chos nyid kyis nyan thos rnams kyi 'dus pa chen po gnyis yod de /
analyzed: 'tsho zhing gzhes pa rnams la chos nyid kyis nyan thos rnams kyi 'dus pa chen po gnyis yod de /
translated: naturally have two great assemblies of śrāvakas:

original: gcig ni dbyar zla 'bring po nya la dbyar nye bar sgrub pa'i tshe'o //
analyzed: gcig ni dbyar zla 'bring po nya la dbyar nye bar sgrub pa'i tshe'o //
translated: one when they establish the rainy season retreat in the middle summer month of Āṣāḍha,

original: gnyis pa ni ston zla 'bring po'i zla ba nya la yin pa de bzhin du nyan thos chen po rnams la yang nyan thos rnams kyi 'dus pa chen po gnyis yod de /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni ston zla 'bring po'i zla ba nya la yin pa de bzhin du nyan thos chen po rnams la yang nyan thos rnams kyi 'dus pa chen po gnyis yod de /
translated: so too the great sravakas have two great assemblies of sravakas.

original: gcig ni dbyar zla 'bring po nya la dbyar nye bar sgrub pa'i tshe'o //
analyzed: gcig ni dbyar zla 'bring po nya la dbyar nye bar sgrub pa'i tshe'o //
translated: One is when they enter the rains retreat on the full moon of the middle month of summer.

original: gnyis pa ni ston zla 'bring po'i zla ba nya la'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni ston zla 'bring po'i zla ba nya la'o //
translated: The second is on the full moon of the middle month of autumn.

original: de la gang dag dbyar zla 'bring po'i nya la dbyar nye bar sgrub pa'i tshe gdams ngag mnos te /
analyzed: de la gang dag dbyar zla 'bring po'i nya la dbyar nye bar sgrub pa'i tshe gdams ngag mnos te /
translated: Those who enter the rains retreat on the full moon of the middle month of summer take instructions and🔽accept the rains retreat in villages, cities, countries and royal palaces.

original: grong dang grong khyer dang yul 'khor dang rgyal po'i pho brang dag tu dbyar gnas par khas len pa de dag ni ston zla 'bring po'i zla ba nya la lhags nas ji ltar thob pa ni rjod par byed /
analyzed: grong dang grong khyer dang yul 'khor dang rgyal po'i pho brang dag tu dbyar gnas par khas len pa de dag ni ston zla 'bring po'i zla ba nya la lhags nas ji ltar thob pa ni rjod par byed /
translated: They arrive on the full moon of the middle month of autumn and proclaim what they have attained.

original: ma thob pa ni thob par byed pa'i phyir 'og tu mdo sde dang 'dul ba dang chos mngon pa de dag gi kha ton dag dang / yongs su 'bri ba dag tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: ma thob pa ni thob par byed pa'i phyir 'og tu mdo sde dang 'dul ba dang chos mngon pa de dag gi kha ton dag dang / yongs su 'bri ba dag tshol bar byed do //
translated: In order to obtain what has not been obtained, he seeks out the recitation and study of those sūtras, vinayas, and abhidharmas.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rta thul gyi lhan cig gnas pa dang / nye gnas gang dag ljongs su dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa de dag dbyar gyi zla ba gsum po dag 'das nas chos gos byas pa dang ldan /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rta thul gyi lhan cig gnas pa dang / nye gnas gang dag ljongs su dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa de dag dbyar gyi zla ba gsum po dag 'das nas chos gos byas pa dang ldan /
translated: Then, the students and disciples of the Venerable Aśvajit who had agreed to spend the rains retreat in the countryside, after the three months of the rains retreat had passed, having made their robes,

original: chos gos zin pa dang ldan zhing lhung bzed dang chos gos thogs te /
analyzed: chos gos zin pa dang ldan zhing lhung bzed dang chos gos thogs te /
translated: having completed their robes, carrying their robes and bowls,

original: @376b tshe dang ldan pa rta thul ga la ba der dong nas phyin pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rta thul gyi rkang pa gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te mtha' gcig tu 'khod do //
analyzed: @376b tshe dang ldan pa rta thul ga la ba der dong nas phyin pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rta thul gyi rkang pa gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te mtha' gcig tu 'khod do //
translated: went to where the Venerable Aśvajit was. Having arrived, they bowed their heads at the feet of the Venerable Aśvajit and sat to one side.

original: mtha' gcig tu 'khod nas /
analyzed: mtha' gcig tu 'khod nas /
translated: Having sat to one side,

original: de dag kha cig ni ji ltar thob pa rjod par byed do //
analyzed: de dag kha cig ni ji ltar thob pa rjod par byed do //
translated: some of them spoke of what they had attained.

original: kha cig ni mdo sde dang / 'dul ba dang chos mngon pa dag gi kha ton dag dang yongs su 'dri ba dag tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: kha cig ni mdo sde dang / 'dul ba dang chos mngon pa dag gi kha ton dag dang yongs su 'dri ba dag tshol bar byed do //
translated: Some of them were seeking to recite the sūtras, the vinaya, and the abhidharma, and to ask questions about them.

original: tshe dang ldan pa rta thul gyis de dag gi sde snod gsum dang bsam gtan gyi lam la som nyi dang yid gnyis yang dag par bcad nas de dag gis phan tshun smra bar brtsams pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rta thul gyis de dag gi sde snod gsum dang bsam gtan gyi lam la som nyi dang yid gnyis yang dag par bcad nas de dag gis phan tshun smra bar brtsams pa /
translated: The Venerable Aśvajit, having resolved his doubts and uncertainties about the three piṭakas and the path of meditation, they began to converse with each other.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag cag gis mkhan po mthong zhing bsnyen bkur byas zin gyis /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag cag gis mkhan po mthong zhing bsnyen bkur byas zin gyis /
translated: “Venerable ones, we have seen the preceptor and served him.

original: da ni rgyal po'i khab tu bcom ldan 'das la bsnyen bkur byed du 'dong ngo //
analyzed: da ni rgyal po'i khab tu bcom ldan 'das la bsnyen bkur byed du 'dong ngo //
translated: Now let us go to Rājagṛha to serve the Blessed One.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa gyad bu nor gyis de dag gis gtam 'dre ba thos nas /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa gyad bu nor gyis de dag gis gtam 'dre ba thos nas /
translated: Then the Venerable Yasa, hearing their conversation,

original: de la kye ma bdag gis kyang bcom ldan 'das blta'o snyam pa'i 'dod pa skyes shing rig nas /
analyzed: de la kye ma bdag gis kyang bcom ldan 'das blta'o snyam pa'i 'dod pa skyes shing rig nas /
translated: thought, “Oh, I too wish to see the Blessed One.”🔽Knowing this, he went to the Venerable Aśvajit

original: tshe dang ldan pa rta thul ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rta thul ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
translated: and said:

original: tshe dang ldan pa rta thul gyi rkang pa gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te; tshe dang ldan pa rta thul la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rta thul gyi rkang pa gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te; tshe dang ldan pa rta thul la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: He bowed his head to the feet of the venerable Aśvajit and said to him:

original: mkhan po mkhyen par mdzod cig /
analyzed: mkhan po mkhyen par mdzod cig /
translated: “Preceptor, please know that

original: bdag gis bcom ldan 'das chos kyi sku'i sgo nas ni mthong /
analyzed: bdag gis bcom ldan 'das chos kyi sku'i sgo nas ni mthong /
translated: I have seen the Blessed One through the body of the Dharma,

original: gzugs kyi sku'i sgo nas ma mthong bas de'i slad du bcom ldan 'das kyi gzugs kyi sku blta bar 'tshal na mchi bar ci gnang /
analyzed: gzugs kyi sku'i sgo nas ma mthong bas de'i slad du bcom ldan 'das kyi gzugs kyi sku blta bar 'tshal na mchi bar ci gnang /
translated: but I have not seen him through the form body. Therefore, if I may, I would like to go and see the Blessed One’s form body.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa rta thul gyis smras pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rta thul gyis smras pa /
translated: The venerable Aśvajit said,

original: bu mnyes kyis blta bar gyis shig /🔽bu de bzhin gshegs pa dgra @377a *//
analyzed: bu mnyes kyis blta bar gyis shig / bu de bzhin gshegs pa dgra @377a *//
translated: “Son, go and see him.

original: bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams dang / de dag 'byung ba ni 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams dang / de dag 'byung ba ni 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Son, the appearance of the tathāgatas, arhats, and perfectly awakened buddhas

original: au dum w'a ra'i me tog bzhin du dkon pa yin gyis de bzhin gyis shig /
analyzed: au dum w'a ra'i me tog bzhin du dkon pa yin gyis de bzhin gyis shig /
translated: is as rare as the appearance of an udumbara flower. Do as you wish.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa gyad bu nor mkhan pos gnang nas /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa gyad bu nor mkhan pos gnang nas /
translated: Then the venerable Aśvajit, having given his permission,

original: bcom ldan 'das la blta bar spro ba'i blo gros kyis yid bde ba skyes nas de nyid kyis mtshan mo 'das pa dang / snga dro sham thabs bgos /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la blta bar spro ba'i blo gros kyis yid bde ba skyes nas de nyid kyis mtshan mo 'das pa dang / snga dro sham thabs bgos /
translated: He was delighted to have the opportunity to see the Blessed One, and he spent the night in joy.

original: lhung bzed dang chos gos thogs te sdig byung du bsod snyoms la zhugs so //
analyzed: lhung bzed dang chos gos thogs te sdig byung du bsod snyoms la zhugs so //
translated: The next morning he put on his lower garment and Dharma robes,🔽and, carrying his alms bowl, he went for alms in Śrāvastī.

original: sdig byung du bsod snyoms brgyus nas zas kyi bya ba byas te /
analyzed: sdig byung du bsod snyoms brgyus nas zas kyi bya ba byas te /
translated: After going for alms in Śrāvastī, he ate his meal,

original: phyi ma'i zas kyi bsod snyoms las phyir ldog pas ji ltar longs spyad pa'i gnas mal mkhos su phab nas /
analyzed: phyi ma'i zas kyi bsod snyoms las phyir ldog pas ji ltar longs spyad pa'i gnas mal mkhos su phab nas /
translated: and, having returned from his alms round, he put away his bedding and seat.

original: lhung bzed dang chos gos thogs te /
analyzed: lhung bzed dang chos gos thogs te /
translated: Carrying his alms bowl and Dharma robes,

original: mkhan po gcig pa dang slob dpon gcig pa dang lhan cig rgyal po'i khab ga la ba der rgyu zhing song nas /
analyzed: mkhan po gcig pa dang slob dpon gcig pa dang lhan cig rgyal po'i khab ga la ba der rgyu zhing song nas /
translated: he set out to travel to Rājagṛha together with his preceptor and teacher.

original: mthar gyis rgyu zhing 'gro ba na rgyal po'i khab tu phyin to //
analyzed: mthar gyis rgyu zhing 'gro ba na rgyal po'i khab tu phyin to //
translated: Traveling by stages, he arrived in Rājagṛha.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa gyad bu nor gyis lhung bzed dang / chos gos mkhos su phab ste /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa gyad bu nor gyis lhung bzed dang / chos gos mkhos su phab ste /
translated: There Venerable Ānanda put away his alms bowl and Dharma robes,

original: rkang pa gnyis bkrus nas /
analyzed: rkang pa gnyis bkrus nas /
translated: washed his feet,

original: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ngo //
translated: and went to where the Blessed One was.

original: de'i tshe na bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi 'khor brgya phrag du ma'i mdun na bzhugs shing chos ston te /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa gyad bu nor thag ring po kho na nas gzigs so //
analyzed: de'i tshe na bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi 'khor brgya phrag du ma'i mdun na bzhugs shing chos ston te / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa gyad bu nor thag ring po kho na nas gzigs so //
translated: At that time, the Blessed One was seated in front of a retinue of many hundreds of monks, teaching the Dharma.🔽The Blessed One saw the venerable Jīvaka Kumārabhṛta from a distance.

original: gzigs nas kyang tshe dang ldan pa gyad bu nor la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: gzigs nas kyang tshe dang ldan pa gyad bu nor la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Having seen him, the Blessed One said to the venerable Jīvaka Kumārabhṛta,

original: gyad bu nor tshur shog 'ongs pa legs so //
analyzed: gyad bu nor tshur shog 'ongs pa legs so //
translated: Jīvaka Kumārabhṛta, come here. Welcome!

original: khyod dus su phyin to //
analyzed: khyod dus su phyin to //
translated: You have come at the right time.

original: gyad bu nor rang @377b gi stan ji lta ba la 'dug cig /
analyzed: gyad bu nor rang @377b gi stan ji lta ba la 'dug cig /
translated: Jīvaka Kumārabhṛta, sit on your own seat as usual.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa gyad bu nor gyis bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te mtha' gcig tu 'dug go /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa gyad bu nor gyis bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te mtha' gcig tu 'dug go /
translated: Then the venerable Jīvaka Kumārabhṛta bowed his head at the Blessed One's two feet and sat to one side.

original: de'i tshe na rgyal po'i khab na gnas mal mi mthun pa 'bog par byed do //
analyzed: de'i tshe na rgyal po'i khab na gnas mal mi mthun pa 'bog par byed do //
translated: At that time, in Rājagṛha, the allocation of bedding was being disputed.

analyzed: mdo sde 'dzin pa rnams dang 'dul ba 'dzin pa rnams kyi /
translated: Between those who uphold the sūtras and those who uphold the Vinaya,

analyzed: mdo sde 'dzin pa rnams dang ma mo 'dzin pa rnams kyi /
translated: those who uphold the sūtras and those who uphold the mātṛkā,

translated: those who uphold the sūtras and those who proclaim the Dharma,🔽those who uphold the sūtras and those who are renunciants,

analyzed: 'dul ba 'dzin pa rnams dang mdo sde 'dzin pa rnams kyi /
translated: those who uphold the vinaya and those who uphold the sūtras,

analyzed: 'dul ba 'dzin pa rnams dang ma mo 'dzin pa rnams kyi /
translated: those who uphold the vinaya and those who uphold the mātṛkā,

analyzed: 'dul ba 'dzin pa rnams dang chos sgrog pa rnams kyi /
translated: those who uphold the vinaya and those who proclaim the Dharma,

analyzed: 'dul ba 'dzin pa rnams dang spong ba pa rnams kyi gnas mal lhan cig 'bog par byed /
translated: those who uphold the vinaya and those who are renunciants,🔽those who uphold the mātṛkā and those who uphold the sūtras,

analyzed: ma mo 'dzin pa rnams dang mdo sde 'dzin pa rnams kyi; ma mo 'dzin pa rnams dang 'dul ba 'dzin pa rnams kyi /

translated: those who uphold the mātṛkā and those who proclaim the Dharma,

analyzed: ma mo 'dzin pa rnams dang spong ba pa rnams kyi gnas mal lhan cig tu 'bog par byed /

analyzed: chos sgrog pa rnams dang ma mo 'dzin pa rnams kyi /

analyzed: chos sgrog pa rnams dang spong ba pa rnams kyi gnas mal lhan cig tu 'bog par byed /

analyzed: spong ba pa rnams dang mdo sde 'dzin pa rnams kyi /
translated: those who practice the renunciant life and those who uphold the sūtras,

analyzed: spong ba pa rnams dang 'dul ba 'dzin pa rnams kyi / spong ba pa rnams @378a *//
translated: those who practice the renunciant life and those who uphold the Vinaya,

analyzed: dang ma mo 'dzin pa rnams kyi /
translated: those who practice the renunciant life and those who uphold the mātṛkā,🔽those who practice the renunciant life and those who teach the Dharma,

analyzed: spong ba pa rnams dang chos sgrog pa rnams kyi gnas mal lhan cig tu 'bog par byed do //
translated: should not be assigned to the same sleeping quarters.

original: gnas mal mi mthun par 'bog pa na dge slong dag phan tshun sems srung bas /
analyzed: gnas mal mi mthun par 'bog pa na dge slong dag phan tshun sems srung bas /
translated: When sleeping quarters are assigned in this way, the monks will be mutually protective of each other.

original: dge ba'i phyogs dag mi byed cing /
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs dag mi byed cing /
translated: They will not engage in virtuous activities,

original: de dag dge ba'i chos rnams kyis mi 'phel te /
analyzed: de dag dge ba'i chos rnams kyis mi 'phel te /
translated: and they will not increase in virtuous qualities,

original: dper na chu med pa na autpal bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na chu med pa na autpal bzhin no //
translated: just as a lotus does not grow in the absence of water.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa gyad bu nor 'dis sngon gyi sangs rgyas rnams dang / bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung gi spyan sngar kye ma bdag skye dgu'i tshe lo brgya pa na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa gyad bu nor 'dis sngon gyi sangs rgyas rnams dang / bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung gi spyan sngar kye ma bdag skye dgu'i tshe lo brgya pa na /
translated: The Blessed One thought, “This son of Jīvaka has made an aspiration in the presence of past buddhas and the blessed, thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddha Kāśyapa:🔽‘Alas, when the human lifespan is one hundred years,

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa'i bstan pa la rab tu byung nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa'i bstan pa la rab tu byung nas /
translated: may I go forth in the doctrine of the blessed, thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddha Śākyamuni,

original: gnas mal 'bog pa rnams kyi mchog tu gyur cig ces smon lam btab pas /
analyzed: gnas mal 'bog pa rnams kyi mchog tu gyur cig ces smon lam btab pas /
translated: and become the best of those who prepare the beds and seats.’🔽”

original: 'di dge slong rnams kyi gnas mal 'bog par skor gzhug go snyam du dgongs nas /
analyzed: 'di dge slong rnams kyi gnas mal 'bog par skor gzhug go snyam du dgongs nas /
translated: He thought, “I will appoint him to prepare the beds and seats for the monks.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa; dge slong dag khyed kyis dge slong gyad bu nor ram /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa; dge slong dag khyed kyis dge slong gyad bu nor ram /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the monks, “Monks, you should appoint the monk Jīvaka’s son
